<strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="http://www.ctdol.state.ct.us/DOLCOVIDFAQ.PDF"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Massachusetts and Delaware will form a joint task force to plan for reopening the economy </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-08 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://portal.ct.gov/-/media/DECD/Covid_Business_Recovery/CTReopens_Offices_C4_V1.pdf?la%3Den"> Offices </a><a target="_blank" href="https://portal.ct.gov/-/media/Coronavirus/COVID-19-FAQs.pdf?la%3Den"> Coronavirus FAQs </a><a target="_blank" href="https://portal.ct.gov/DECD/Content/Coronavirus-Business-Recovery/Sector-Rules-for-May-20-Reopen"> Sector Guidelines for May 20th Reopening </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Delaware')" data-value="9" class="collapsible">Delaware</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Phased reopening Plan </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://governor.delaware.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/24/2020/05/Second-Extension-of-State-of-Emergency-05082020.pdf" target="_blank"> Executive Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://governor.delaware.gov/delawares-recovery/" target="_blank"> Delaware Recovers </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now: <br /> 1. Food and drink Farmers markets; Restaurants, bars and breweries (Operate with a 30% capacity and maintain six-foot distance)<br /> 2. Outdoor and recreation Beaches; Pools; Gyms<br /> 3. Retail stores; Malls (Operate with a 30% capacity and maintain six-foot distance)<br /> 4. Entertainment Museums, libraries, galleries, live performances; Casinos (Indoor venues, limit up to 30% capacity while ensuring a six-foot radius around individual household units.)<br /> 5. Personal care Barber shops, hair salons, tanning salons (Operate with a 30% of fire capacity and maintain six-foot distance)<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Governor John Carney announced a series of interim steps allowing small businesses to resume limited operations effective Friday, May 8. The following criteria must first be met, based on federal guidelines:<br /> <br /> WHAT NEEDS TO HAPPEN FIRST:<br /> 1.14-day decline in percent of positive cases.<br /> 2. Ability to treat COVID-19 patients in hospitals without crisis care.<br /> 3. Extensive testing programs for health care workers.<br /> <br /> TO GET THERE, WE NEED:<br /> 1.Widespread testing<br /> 2. Increased and enhanced contact tracing, especially in vulnerable populations.<br /> 3. Adequate supply of personal protective equipment.<br /> 4. Protecting health and safety of workforce.<br /> 5. Public guidance on social distancing and face coverings.<br /> 6. Constant monitoring of situation to mitigate new outbreaks.<br /> <br /> THEN WE CAN IMPLEMENT PHASES OF RESTART.<br /> 1. All businesses are still requested to have staff work from home as much as possible. However, if a retailer needs some in-person staffing to be able to provide curbside pickup, it is permitted to do so using best judgement for health and safety of workers and customers.<br /> 2. Review plans to operate with adaptations such as telework and flexible sick leave policies that permit employees to stay home and care for a sick family member.<br /> 3. Review other contingency or emergency operations plans.<br /> 4. Communicate policies and plans with employees.<br /> 5. Cross-train personnel to perform essential functions so that the workplace is able to operate even if key staff are absent.<br /> 6. Have a plan in place if an employee does get sick at the workplace.<br /> 7. Consider not requiring a health care provider's note for employees with an acute respiratory illness.<br /> 8. Employers must screen each incoming employee with a basic questionnaire, which should include at least the below, however can be made more comprehensive and/or employer-specific in consultation with medical professionals.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Required for high-risk businesses and recommended for all others: each employee must be asked about and report body temperature at or above 99.5F. If a facility has the capability to perform active temperature monitoring, they may do so. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Employer must require employees to report their temperature daily - above 99.5 means they are ineligible to work.<br /> 2. All employees who are able to work from home should be working from home at this time.<br /> 3. If facility has the capability to perform active temperature monitoring, they may do so. If an employee reports or is noted to have body temperature at or above 99.5 degrees Fahrenheit, that employee should be sent home or undergo secondary screening by facility medical personnel, if available at facility.<br /> 4. It is best to use touchless thermometers (forehead/temporal artery thermometers) if possible, but if you must use oral or other types of thermometers, make sure to clean the thermometers thoroughly between each employee, as to not spread infection.<br /> 5. What you can do to mitigate the impact of COVID-19:<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Employees and customers must wear cloth face masks at all times.<br /> 2. Staff must wear disposable gloves when providing services and must throw away gloves between customers and wash hands.<br /> 3. Maintain social distancing (at least 6 feet from others).<br /> 4. Practice good hand hygiene.<br /> 5. Cough or sneeze into your elbow.<br /> 6. Clean frequently used surfaces often.<br /> 7. Outside of essential jobs, limit your time in public.<br /> 8. Keep gatherings to 10 people or less.<br /> 9. Don't go to work if you are sick.<br /> 10. Call your doctor about testing if you are experiencing symptoms.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific</strong><br> 1. No more than two appointments at a time per location (and never more than the number of available staff, so just one for a sole proprietor). Need to leave 15 minutes between appointments for proper cleaning.<br /> 2. Employers should close COMMON AREAS where personnel are likely to congregate and interact, or enforce strict social distancing protocols.<br /> 3. Employers are encouraged to continue to have staff work from home whenever possible. Employees who have been working from home throughout this crisis should continue working from home unless there is a substantive change to business operations in Phase 1 (e.g. a business was closed, but now it's open). </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. All employees should wash hands regularly with soap and water throughout the work day, and in particular after any time they come into contact with a customer. <br /> 2. Hand sanitizer should be used to supplement hand washing throughout the day. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Customer stations must be sanitized between use, along with any equipment used for the customer. In addition, any item a customer handles (like a magazine) must leave with the customer.<br /> 2. Downtime should be given between shifts and after closing for thorough cleanings of an establishment at a minimum after each day.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Delaware hospitals and health care practices can resume elective procedures and routine primary care services because the state has seen a decrease in hospitalizations and an increase in the availability of personal protective equipment. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.dol.gov/agencies/whd/pandemic/ffcra-employer-paid-leave"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Massachusetts and Delaware will form a joint task force to plan for reopening the economy </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-12 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://news.delaware.gov/2020/05/05/governor-carney-announces-interim-steps-allowing-small-businesses-universal-testing-in-nursing-homes/"> Interim Steps for Small Businesses Reopening </a><a target="_blank" href="https://business.delaware.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/118/2020/05/FAQ-on-15th-Modification-DSB.pdf"> FAQs on Health Mandate </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on District of Columbia')" data-value="10" class="collapsible">District of Columbia</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Regional reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://coronavirus.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/coronavirus/page_content/attachments/Mayors-Order-2020-066-Extensions-of-Public-Emergency-and-Public-Health.pdf" target="_blank"> Stay at Home Executive Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://coronavirus.dc.gov/reopendc" target="_blank"> ReOpen DC </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Food and drink Restaurants open for outdoor dining (Maintain six-foot distance, limited to outdoor service only and carry-out service)<br /> 2. Retail stores open to curbside pickup (Operate with 25%-50% capacity with PPD and social distancing policies in place.)<br /> 3. Entertainment Libraries open to curbside pickup (patrons must stay outside)<br /> 4. Outdoor and recreation Dog parks, golf courses, tennis courts, parks (Contact sports and groups of more than 10 people remain prohibited.<br /> 5. Personal care Barber Shops, hair salons (Maintain a six-foot distance when possible and no more than 1 client per stylist/barber in the hair salon.)<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> UNIVERSAL SAFEGUARDS FOR INDIVIDUALS: <br /> 1. Physical distancing of at least 6 ft when not<br /> at homesupported where feasible by social<br /> distancing ambassadors in hotspots and high-risk<br /> 2. Use of masks in public spaces, including on public<br /> transportation and at work/school<br /> 3. Stringent personal sanitation and hygiene<br /> practices (e.g., frequent hand washing)<br /> 4. Staying home when sick<br /> 5. Regular disinfection of surfaces and objects<br /> 6. Enhanced precautions if you are near or are part of a group that is particularly vulnerable to COVID-19 risks (e.g., seniors, immunocompromised individuals)<br /> <br /> UNIVERSAL SAFEGUARDS FOR EMPLOYERS AND VENUES:<br /> 1. Physical distancing of at least 6 ft for employees and patrons (or other safeguard measures where not possible because of the nature of the service, as with checkout counters)supported by social distancing ambassadors to serve as credible messengers in high-risk areas<br /> 2. Regular cleaning and strict sanitation standards<br /> in the workplace<br /> 3. Use of health screenings and protective equipment (e.g., temperature checks, symptom questionnaires, PPE) for employees and patrons.<br /> 4. Protections for workers and their families who are fearful of illness, especially those from vulnerable populations (e.g., ensuring workers who fall ill have their jobs protected, workers able to self-isolate, family leave).<br /> <br /> UNIVERSAL SAFEGUARDS ACROSS STAGES<br /> 1. Education of employees about COVID-19<br /> 2. Strategies for addressing and accommodating ill employees (e.g., paid sick and family leave)<br /> 3. Testing: providing focused and intentional testing (e.g., hotspots, shelters, nursing homes, schools and<br /> universities) and ensuring testing becomes more widely available through each stage<br /> 4. Contact tracing: identifying, notifying, and monitoring contacts of infected individuals through Stage 3; DC should leverage its own residentsespecially those facing economic hardship and who have deep community tiesto ensure the contact tracing workforce is culturally competent.<br /> 5. Temperature monitoring and symptom questionnaire: encouraging employers to conduct daily temperature and symptom monitoring, especially in Stages 1 and 2, with an emphasis on individual self-monitoring in later stages.<br /> 6. Education: empowering residents to understand their risks and know what to do to mitigate them.<br /> 7. Worker training and reskilling: meeting the immediate job needs of the healthcare sector and supporting investment to reskill and retrain DCs most impacted communities. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended for high risk</strong><br> Testing: Providing focused and intentional testing (e.g., hotspots, shelters, nursing homes, schools and universities) and ensuring testing becomes more widely available through each stage.
Contact tracing: Identifying, notifying, and monitoring contacts of infected individuals through Stage 3; DC should leverage its own residentsespecially those facing economic hardship and who have deep community tiesto ensure the contact tracing workforce is culturally competent </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Advised for all employers: <br /> 1. Use of health screenings for employees and patrons. <br /> 2. Encourage employers to conduct daily temperature and symptom monitoring, especially in Stages 1 and 2, with an emphasis on individual self-monitoring in later stages.<br /> <br /> Some industries may require stricter guidance; see industry-specific guidance here: https://coronavirus.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/coronavirus/page_content/attachments/%23ReOpen%20DC%20Advisory%20Group%20Recommendations%20to%20Mayor%20Bowser.pdf </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. All individuals must use face masks in public spaces, including on public<br /> transportation and at work/school.<br /> 2. All employers and venues must use health screenings and protective equipment (e.g., temperature checks, symptom questionnaires, PPE) for employees and patrons.<br /> <br /> Some industries may require stricter guidance; see industry-specific guidance here: https://coronavirus.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/coronavirus/page_content/attachments/%23ReOpen%20DC%20Advisory%20Group%20Recommendations%20to%20Mayor%20Bowser.pdf </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Physical distancing of at least 6 ft when not at homesupported where feasible by social distancing ambassadors in hotspots and high-risk areas.<br /> 2. Physical distancing of at least 6 ft for employees and patrons (or other safeguard measures where not possible because of the nature of the service, as with checkout counters)supported by social distancing ambassadors to serve as credible messengers in high-risk areas.<br /> 3. Some industries may require stricter guidance; see industry-specific guidance here: https://coronavirus.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/coronavirus/page_content/attachments/%23ReOpen%20DC%20Advisory%20Group%20Recommendations%20to%20Mayor%20Bowser.pdf </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. All individuals should adopt stringent personal sanitation and hygiene<br /> practices (e.g., frequent hand washing). <br /> 2. Wash hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds multiple times a day. An alcohol-based hand sanitizer can be used if soap and water are not available and avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands<br /> 3. Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands. <br /> 4. All industries and facilities are required to have regular cleaning and strict sanitation standards<br /> in the workplace. <br /> <br /> Some industries may require stricter guidance; see industry-specific guidance here: https://coronavirus.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/coronavirus/page_content/attachments/%23ReOpen%20DC%20Advisory%20Group%20Recommendations%20to%20Mayor%20Bowser.pdf<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Regular disinfection of surfaces and objects. <br /> 2. Regular cleaning and strict sanitation standards<br /> in the workplace.<br /> <br /> Some industries may require stricter guidance; see industry-specific guidance here: https://coronavirus.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/coronavirus/page_content/attachments/%23ReOpen%20DC%20Advisory%20Group%20Recommendations%20to%20Mayor%20Bowser.pdf </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> 1. Offices are asked to telephone screen all patients for COVID-19 symptoms prior to their arrival at the office.<br /> 2. All patients are required to wear face "coverings".<br /> 3. Facilities are encouraged to discourage lingering in a waiting room by eliminating chairs and spacing the remaining 6 feet; prohibiting people accompanying the patients if possible; and "maintain low patient volume".<br /> 4. Healthcare facilities should implement sick leave policies for all employees, send home any who have illness symptoms, and ask staff to monitor themselves for symptoms. There is no provision offering free testing for healthcare workers at any time, as the MSDC COVID-19 Task Force has recommended.<br /> 5.Facilities should only open if they possess adequate PPE supplies (more to come on how to do this from MSDC).<br /> 6.All providers should wear surgical masks at all times. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.mcguirewoods.com/client-resources/Alerts/2020/4/covid-19-dc-amends-sick-and-safe-leave-law-to-align-with-ffcra"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-10 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Florida')" data-value="11" class="collapsible">Florida</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.flgov.com/wp-content/uploads/orders/2020/EO_20-112.pdf" target="_blank"> Phase 1: Safe. Smart. Step-by-Step </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.flgov.com/wp-content/uploads/covid19/Taskforce%20Report.pdf" target="_blank"> Safe. Smart. Step-by-Step </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Food and drink Restaurant dining (Operate with a 50% capacity, maintain six-foot distancing, and parties should not exceed 10 people)<br /> 2. Retail stores (Operate with a 50% capacity)<br /> 3. Outdoor and recreation Beaches (Beach access should be limited to parties of 10 or less with 6-feet distance between groups.)<br /> 4. Trails (Visitors will not have access to certain amenities, such as pavilions, picnic areas and campsites, due to sections of the park being closed or staff and visitor safety considerations)<br /> 5. Gyms (Operate with a 50% capacity and maintain six-foot distancing) <br /> 6. Houses of worship (Operate with a 25% capacity)<br /> 7. Entertainment Sporting venues without spectators (Operate with a 25% capacity)<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> The following general guidance is recommended for all employers throughout each phase of re-opening.<br /> <br /> 1. Employers should prepare their workplaces and consider how to minimize the spread of COVID-19 and lower the impact in their workplace.<br /> 2. Employers are urged to avoid non-essential travel and adhere to CDC guidelines regarding isolation following travel.<br /> 3. Requirements for in-person quorum for a local government body to meet are suspended and the use of technology and video conferencing for local government meetings is authorized. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> All employers are urged to screen employees before entering the premises for symptoms of COVID-19 or influenza like illness and, where practical, take the temperature of each employee </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. All employers are urged to screen employees before entering the premises for symptoms of COVID-19 or influenza like illness and, where practical, take the temperature of each employee<br /> 2. Encourage employees who feel sick to stay home and monitor employees for COVID-19 symptoms.<br /> 3. Do not allow symptomatic people to physically return to work until they meet CDC criteria to do so and are cleared by a medical provider. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> For businesses that are close contact or have a high potential for exposure to COVID-19, require employees to wear masks, cloth face coverings or other PPE while inside or within close proximity to members of the public. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. All employers should encourage teleworking, where practical. Employers should develop plans for employees to return to work in phases, which should be implemented in subsequent phases of the Safe. Smart. Step-by-Step. plan. <br /> 2. Practice social distancing, as the virus is most transmissible indoors under close, sustained contact. If you are around other people, try to maintain 6 feet of separation. <br /> 3. Avoid hugs, handshakes, large gatherings and close quarters. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Develop and implement policies and procedures to train employees on personal hygiene expectations, including increased frequency of hand washing, the use of hand sanitizers with at least 60 percent alcohol and, clear instruction to avoid touching hands to face.<br /> 2. Make hand sanitizer, disinfecting wipes, soap and water, or similar disinfectant readily available to employees and customers.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Clean and disinfect high-touch, high-traffic surface areas.<br /> 2. Make hand sanitizer, disinfecting wipes, soap and water, or similar disinfectant readily available to employees and customers. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Develop and implement policies and procedures for workforce tracing following a positive COVID-19 test by an employee or an employee who has come into contact with an individual testing positive for COVID-19. <br /> 2. Encourage employees who feel sick to stay home and monitor employees for COVID-19 symptoms.<br /> 3. Do not allow symptomatic people to physically return to work until they meet CDC criteria to do so and are cleared by a medical provider. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> On May 4, 2020, Executive Order 20-112, went into effect and contains certain measures adopted by Governor DeSantis as part of Phase 1 of the "Safe. Smart. Step-by-Step. Plan for Florida's Recovery." One such measure ended the prohibition on Florida health care providers providing elective surgery, where certain conditions are met. <br /> <br /> Section 5. Medical Procedures<br /> <br /> Subject to the conditions outlined below, elective procedures prohibited by Executive Order 20-72 may resume when this order goes into effect. A hospital ambulatory surgical center, office surgery center, dental office, orthodontic office, endodontic office or other health care practitioners' office in the State of Florida may perform procedures prohibited by Executive Order 20-72 only if: <br /> A. The facility has the capacity to immediately convert additional facility-identified surgical and intensive care beds for treatment of COVID-19 patients in a surge capacity situation;<br /> B. The facility has adequate personal protective equipment (PPE) to complete all medical procedures and respond to COVID-19 treatment needs, without the facility seeking any additional federal or state assistance regarding PPE supplies;<br /> C. The facility has not sought any additional federal, state, or local government assistance regarding PPE supplies since resuming elective procedures; and<br /> D. The facility has not refused to provide support to and proactively engage with skilled nursing facilities, assisted living facilities and other long-term care residential providers. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Recommended closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://fuba.org/2020/03/20/new-law-requires-paid-leave-for-employees-affected-by-covid-19/"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-11 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.flgov.com/wp-content/uploads/covid19/Taskforce%2520Report.pdf"> Safe. Smart. Step-by-Step </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Georgia')" data-value="13" class="collapsible">Georgia</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://gov.georgia.gov/executive-action/executive-orders/2020-executive-orders" target="_blank"> Reviving a Healthy Georgia </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://gov.georgia.gov/document/2020-executive-order/04232002/download" target="_blank"> Reviving a Healthy Georgia </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation Gyms (Maintain social distancing, cessation of group classes and childcare services)<br /> 2. Entertainment Bowling alleys; Theaters, private social clubs; Bars, nightclubs (limit the number of total persons inside the bar to 25 persons or 35% of total listed fire capacity occupancy of the entire bar, whichever is greater.)<br /> 3. Personal care Hair salons, barbershops, etc. (Maintain social distancing and general preventative measures)<br /> 4. Food and drink Restaurant dining (Now allowed to have 10 patrons per 300 feet) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> All businesses shall implement measures that mitigate the exposure and spread of COVD-19 among its workforces. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> 1. Screening and evaluating workers who exhibit signs of illness such as fever over 100.4 degrees Fahrenheit, cough or shortness of breath <br /> 2. If retail business, posting a sign on the storefront stating that individuals who have a fever or other symptoms of COVID-19 shall not enter the store<br /> 3. Requiring workers who exhibit signs of illness to note report to work or to seek medical attention </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Provide Personal Protective Equipment as available and appropriate to the function and location of the worker within the business location. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Prohibit gatherings of workers during work hours<br /> 2. Permitting workers to take breaks and meals outside their office or personal workspace, or in such areas where proper social distancing is attainable<br /> 3. Implementing teleworking for all possible workers<br /> 4. Implementing staggered shifts for all possible workers<br /> 5. Holding all meetings and conferences virtually, whenever possible<br /> 6. Delivering intangible services remotely whenever possible<br /> 7. Discouraging workers from using other workers' phones, desks, offices, or other working tools and equipment<br /> 8. Prohibiting handshakes and other unnecessary person-to-person contact in the workplace<br /> 9. Enforcing social distancing of non-cohabiting persons while present on such entity's leased or owned property<br /> 10. For retailers and services providers, providing alternative points of sale outside the buildings, including curbside pick-up and or delivery of products and/or services if an alternative point of sale is permitted under Georgia Law<br /> 11. Open sales registers must be at least 6 feet apart<br /> 12. Increasing physical space between workers and patrons, <br /> 13. Suspending the us of Personal Identification Number pads, PIN entry devices, electronic signature capture, and any other credit card receipt signature requirements to the extent such suspension is permitted by agreements with the credit card companies and credit agencies <br /> <br /> Additionally recommended: Increasing the physical space between workers' worksites to at least 6 feet </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Require hand washing or sanitation by workers at appropriate places within the business location <br /> 2. Discouraging workers from using other workers' phones, desks, offices, or other working tools and equipment<br /> 3. Prohibiting handshakes and other unnecessary person-to-person contact in the workplace<br /> 4. Notices that encourage hand hygiene at the entrance to the workplace and in other workplace areas where they are likely to be seen </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Enhance sanitation of the workplace as appropriate<br /> 2. Disinfect common surfaces regularly<br /> 3. Require hand washing or sanitation by workers at appropriate places within the business location <br /> 4. Discouraging workers from using other workers' phones, desks, offices, or other working tools and equipment<br /> 5. Point of sale equipment should be frequently cleaned and sanitized<br /> <br /> Recommended: Providing disinfectant and sanitation products for workers to clean their workspace, equipment, and tools<br /> <br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.gachamber.com/hr6201-families-first-coronavirus-response-act/"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-15 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://gov.georgia.gov/document/2020-executive-order/04232002/download"> Executive Order - Reviving a Healthy Georgia </a><a target="_blank" href="https://gov.georgia.gov/document/2020-executive-order/04202001/download"> Executive Order - Minimum Operations </a><a target="_blank" href="https://dph.georgia.gov/covid-19-businesses-and-employers"> COVID-19 Businesses and Employers </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Guam')" data-value="12" class="collapsible">Guam</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.ghs.guam.gov/sites/default/files/dphss_guidance_memo_2020-07_final.pdf" target="_blank"> Guidance Memo </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://files.constantcontact.com/b3d7e81d001/9cd5a857-0ed3-460f-b66c-66bb6aca77b8.pdf" target="_blank"> Reopening </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Place of Worship (Operate with a 50% capacity or 10 people, whichever is greater)<br /> Gym (Open with a focus on new sanitary standards) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> 1. Employers should consider ways of reducing the number of employees present at the workplace. Possible options include staggered shifts, alternating teams, and/or continued telework<br /> 2. Set up and control shift and location teams<br /> 3. Set-up drop boxes, deliveries, online ordering<br /> 4. Use remote communication, even in the workplace<br /> 5. Don't hesitate to act on symptoms of COVID-19<br /> 6. Update procedures to ensure protective processes<br /> 7. Create then train employees on social distancing policies and protocols; designate individuals to monitor and assess compliance<br /> 8. Additionally, signs and other reminders for customers and employees to keep a distance of six feet, avoid touching surfaces unnecessarily; sanitize properly and regularly and wear a mask.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information Coming Soon</strong><br> Information Coming Soon </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Implement regular screening protocols for employees, customers, clients, and other workplace visitors. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Wear face masks </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Social distancing policies, including separating desks and workstations with space and partitions; closing common rooms<br /> 2. Limit in-person interactions and physical contact </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information Coming Soon</strong><br> Information Coming Soon </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Update sanitary workplace conditions policies to ensure consistent cleaning<br /> 2. Sanitize properly; sanitize and ventilate bathrooms frequently </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information Coming Soon</strong><br> Information Coming Soon </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information Coming Soon</strong><br> Information Coming Soon </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Information Coming Soon </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="Information Coming Soon"> Information Coming Soon </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-11 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Hawaii')" data-value="14" class="collapsible">Hawaii</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Regional reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://governor.hawaii.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/2005024-ATG_Seventh-Supplementary-Proclamation-for-COVID-19-distribution-signed-1.pdf" target="_blank"> Stay at Home Updates: Seventh Supplementary Proclamation </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://dod.hawaii.gov/hiema/seventh-supplementary-proclamation-covid-19/" target="_blank"> SEVENTH SUPPLEMENTARY PROCLAMATION COVID-19 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation Beaches, piers, docks, etc.; State parks; Pools and waterparks in some areas; Campgrounds in some areas; Parks and beaches; Gyms in some areas (10 or less people)<br /> 2. Retail stores (Capacity limits and maintain social distancing)<br /> 3. Personal care Pet groomers; Salons and barbershops in some areas; Nail salons in some areas; Tattoo parlors in some areas (Operate with 50% capacity and maintain social distancing)<br /> 4. Industries Construction in some areas<br /> 5. Houses of worship (Maintain social distancing)<br /> 6. Food and drink Restaurant dining in some areas (Limited to 10 or less for members under the same roof and maintain social distancing in dining areas and bathrooms)<br /> <br /> Reopening soon<br /> 1. Industries Offices in some areas </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Four phase reopening plan in progress. Currently in phase two (reopening) as of the beginning of June. Phase 2 includes reopening indoor gathering places, indoor exercise facilities, museums, theaters, personal services, and restaurants for dining-in. Large venues, bars, and clubs still remain closed. General guidance advises high risk populations to stay at home, no gatherings >10 people, and maintain >6ft of physical distance. Businesses must follow CDC and OSHA guidelines, in addition to state guidelines and industry-specific guidelines. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> 1. Employees who develop symptoms of COVID-19 while at work should be dismissed as soon as possible to self-isolate at home or seek medical attention as appropriate.<br /> 2. Anyone visibly displaying symptoms of COVID-19 should not be allowed in the business or operation. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Cloth face coverings worn at all times by employees and public when outside the home (except solo exercising), including when in transit other than personal vehicle. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> All essential and designated businesses and operations identified herein, and persons engaged in permitted activities identified herein, shall exercise the following social distancing requirements to the fullest extent possible:<br /> 1. Workers should be encouraged to work remotely when possible. <br /> 2. High risk populations. Elderly and others at high risk for COVID-19 are urged to stay in their residences to the extent possible, except as necessary to seek medical care.<br /> 2. Persons who are sick. Persons who are sick or have a fever or cough or are exhibiting symptoms such as shortness of breath or difficulty breathing, chills, repeated shaking with chills, muscle pain, headache, sore throat, or new loss of taste or smell, are urged to stay in their residences to the extent possible, except as necessary to seek medical care.<br /> 3. Six-foot distances. All persons shall maintain a minimum of six-feet of physical separation from all other persons to the fullest extent possible. Essential and designated businesses or operations shall designate with signage, tape, or by other means six-foot spacing for employees and customers in line to maintain appropriate distance. Essential and designated businesses or operations shall monitor and enforce the six-foot distancing requirement set forth in this Proclamation, whether outside waiting lines or as customers move about inside a facility. Checkout operations shall be modified, to the extent reasonably feasible, to provide this separation or to provide a transparent shield or barrier between customers and checkout clerks. <br /> 4. Safeguards for high risk populations. Essential and designated businesses or operations are urged to implement processes to safeguard elderly and high risk customers. High risk persons are encouraged to stay in their residence to the extent possible, except as necessary to seek medical care.<br /> 5. Online and remote access. Essential and designated businesses or operations shall post online whether a facility is open and how best to reach the facility and continue services by phone or remotely. Essential and designated businesses or operations shall encourage their customers to do their business remotely by phone or online to the extent possible.<br /> 6. Pickup at store or delivery. Essential and designated businesses or operations shall provide for, if feasible, online ordering and purchase of goods and customer pickup of orders at a location outside the facility or shall provide for delivery to customer locations.<br /> 7. Signage. Essential and designated businesses or operations shall post a sign at the entrance of the facility informing all employees and customers that they should: wear CDC recommended face coverings while in the business or operation; avoid entering the business or operation if they have a cough or fever or otherwise do not feel well; maintain a six-foot distance from one another; not shake hands or engage in unnecessary physical contact. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Essential and designated businesses or operations shall make hand sanitizer and sanitizing products readily available for employees and customers. Employees handling items from customers, such as cash or credit cards, shall frequently utilize hand sanitizers. <br /> 2. Signs should be posted throughout the area reminding visitors and employees of physical distancing and to wash their hands.<br /> 3. Employees should be trained on the importance of frequent hand washing with soap and water, the use of hand sanitizers with at least 60% alcohol content, and the importance of avoiding touching hands to face.<br /> 4. Employees should be given frequent opportunities to wash their hands. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Essential and designated businesses or operations shall regularly disinfect all high-touch surfaces. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Depends on Facility</strong><br> 1. Physicians in more states can resume at least some elective procedures, as governors continue to reopen their states amid the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. Requirements vary, but share some common features.<br /> <br /> 1a. Most states want you to have or obtain sufficient protective equipment, without affecting local government resources.<br /> 1b. You should also ensure appropriate hygiene/cleaning, signage and social distancing, where possible.<br /> 1c. Some states recommend or require a negative COVID-19 test result or lack of contact with an infected person prior to surgery. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://labor.hawaii.gov/ui/files/2020/03/COVID-19-Labor-Benefits-Fact-Sheet_20200319.pdf"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-10 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://governor.hawaii.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/2005024-ATG_Seventh-Supplementary-Proclamation-for-COVID-19-distribution-signed-1.pdf"> Seventh Supplementary Proclamation </a><a target="_blank" href="https://dohvid19.wpengine.com/guidance-for-everyone/"> Guidance for Everyone </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Idaho')" data-value="15" class="collapsible">Idaho</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="N/A" target="_blank"> Stay Healthy Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://rebound.idaho.gov/stages-of-reopening/" target="_blank"> Rebound Idaho </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Houses of worship (Maintain six-foot distancing)<br /> 2. Outdoor and recreation Gyms; Pools and waterparks (Maintain six-foot distance and capacity limits)<br /> 3. Food and drink Restaurant dining (Maintain six-foot distance, operate with a 50% capacity, limited to 6 people per table)<br /> 4. Bars (Maintain six-foot distance and operate with a 50% capacity)<br /> 5. Personal care Hair salons (Maintain six-foot distance when possible and only one client per service provider)<br /> 6. Entertainment Movie theaters (Maintain six-foot distance, limited seating at one time, requiring a minimum of three seats between parties) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Businesses opening their doors in various stages of the Idaho Rebound plan should have operational plans in place to mitigate the risk of spreading COVID-19. Included here are protocols for specific businesses. Additional protocols for other specific businesses will be added when they are available. The plans do not need to be submitted for review or approval. However, to ensure consumer confidence, businesses are encouraged to make their plans available to the public. All open businesses continue to follow plans.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> On a case-by-case basis, include other practices such as screening of employees for illness and exposures upon work entry, requiring non-cash transactions, etc. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Identify strategies for addressing ill employees, which should include requiring COVID-19 positive employees to stay at home while contagious and may include restricting employees who were directly exposed to the COVID-19 positive employee, as well as the closure of the facility until it can be properly disinfected.<br /> 2. On a case-by-case basis, include other practices such as screening of employees for illness and exposures upon work entry </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Identify how personal use items such as masks, face coverings and gloves shall be worn, if necessary, for employees, vendors, and patrons.<br /> 2. The businesses may require, and it is encouraged, that employees, vendors and patrons wear face coverings as a business practice. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Establish a protocol to maintain the six (6) foot physical distancing requirements for employees and patrons.<br /> 1. Consider the use of telework to limit the number of employees in the facility during business hours when vendors and patrons might be present.<br /> 2. Consider staggering work hours for those who must be present in the business. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Identify how the business will provide adequate sanitation and personal hygiene for employees, vendors and patrons.<br /> 2. Identify how the business will provide for disinfection of the business and regular cleaning, especially of high touch surfaces. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Identify how the business will provide for disinfection of the business and regular cleaning, especially of high touch surfaces. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Identify strategies for addressing ill employees, which should include requiring COVID-19 positive employees to stay at home while contagious and may include restricting employees who were directly exposed to the COVID-19 positive employee, as well as the closure of the facility until it can be properly disinfected. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Depending on facility, starting May 1 elective surgeries will be resuming. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Recommended closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://labor.idaho.gov/dnn/COVID-19"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-15 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://rebound.idaho.gov/business-specific-protocols-for-opening/"> Business Specific Protocols </a><a target="_blank" href="https://rebound.idaho.gov/stage-1-protocols-for-opening/"> Stage 1 - General Business </a><a target="_blank" href="https://rebound.idaho.gov/stage-2-protocols-for-opening/"> Stage 2 - General Business </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Illinois')" data-value="16" class="collapsible">Illinois</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Regional reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www2.illinois.gov/Pages/Executive-Orders/ExecutiveOrder2020-32.aspx" target="_blank"> Stay at Home Executive Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://coronavirus.illinois.gov/sfc/servlet.shepherd/document/download/069t000000BadS0AAJ?operationContext=S1" target="_blank"> Restore Illinois </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Bar and restaurants (outdoor seating only and maintain six-foot distancing)<br /> 2. Retail (Non-essential businesses must maintain social distancing and other restrictions)<br /> 3. Outdoor activities; indoor and outdoor tennis (Golf with foursomes allowed and one person per cart and boating or camping with up to 10 people)<br /> 4. Personal care; barber shops, salons, tattoo shops (Must follow capacity limits and other precautions)<br /> 5. Gyms (Outdoor classes for up to 10 people and one-on-one personal training indoors and outdoors are allowed. Must follow capacity limits and other precautions)<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Illinois is currently in stage 3 of a 5 stage reopening plan. Manufacturing, retail, offices, barbershops, and salons can reopen to the public with capacity and other limits and safety precautions. Gatherings of 10 people or fewer are allowed. Face coverings and social distancing are the norm. <br /> <br /> 1. All businesses must evaluate which employees are able to work from home, and are encouraged to facilitate remote work from home when possible. All businesses that have employees physically reporting to a work-site must post the guidance from the Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH) and Office of the Illinois Attorney General regarding workplace safety during the COVID-19 emergency. The guidance will be posted on the IDPH webpage.<br /> <br /> 2. All employers need to consider how best to decrease the spread of acute respiratory illness and lower the impact of COVID-19 in their workplace in the event of an outbreak in the US. They should identify and communicate their objectives, which may include one or more of the following: (a) reducing transmission among staff, (b) protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, (c) maintaining business operations, and (d) minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains. Some of the key considerations when making decisions on appropriate responses are:<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Actively encourage sick employees to stay home:<br /> 1. Employees who are sick and have respiratory symptoms, such as fever, cough, and shortness of breath, stay home unless you need medical attention. For individuals not feeling well and having symptoms: stay home for at least 7 days after onset or 72 hours after fever resolved and symptoms are improving-whichever is longer.<br /> Ensure that your sick leave policies are flexible and consistent with public health guidance and that employees are aware of these policies.<br /> 2. Talk with companies that provide your business with contract or temporary employees about the importance of sick employees staying home and encourage them to develop non-punitive leave policies. Do not require a healthcare provider's note for employees who are sick with acute respiratory illness to validate their illness or to return to work, as healthcare provider offices and medical facilities may be extremely busy and not able to provide such documentation in a timely way.<br /> 3. IDPH recommends that employees who appear to have acute respiratory illness symptoms (i.e. cough, shortness of breath) upon arrival to work or become sick during the day should be separated from other employees and be sent home immediately. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Provide employees with appropriate face coverings and requiring that employees wear face coverings where maintaining a six-foot social distance is not possible at all times. <br /> 2. When the work circumstances require, providing employees with other PPE in addition to face coverings. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Designating with signage, tape, or by other means six-foot spacing for employees and customers in line to maintain appropriate distance.<br /> <br /> 2. Requirements for essential stores - Retail stores (including, but not limited to, stores that sell groceries and medicine, hardware stores, and greenhouses, garden centers, and nurseries) designated as Essential Businesses and Operations under this order shall to the greatest extent possible.<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Place posters that encourage staying home when sick, cough and sneeze etiquette, and hand hygiene at the entrance to your workplace and in other workplace areas where they are likely to be seen.<br /> 2. Provide tissues and no-touch disposal receptacles for use by employees.<br /> 3. Instruct employees to clean their hands often with an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60-95% alcohol, or wash their hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Soap and water should be used preferentially if hands are visibly dirty.<br /> 4. Provide soap and water and alcohol-based hand rubs in the workplace. Ensure that adequate supplies are maintained. Place hand rubs in multiple locations or in conference rooms to encourage hand hygiene. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Routinely clean all frequently touched surfaces in the workplace, such as workstations, countertops, and doorknobs. Use the cleaning agents that are usually used in these areas and follow the directions on the label.<br /> 2. No additional disinfection beyond routine cleaning is recommended at this time.<br /> 3. Provide disposable wipes so that commonly used surfaces (for example, doorknobs, keyboards, remote controls, desks) can be wiped down by employees before each use. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> If an employee is confirmed to have COVID-19, employers should inform fellow employees of their possible exposure to COVID-19 in the workplace but maintain confidentiality as required by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). Employees exposed to a co-worker with confirmed COVID-19 should refer to CDC guidance for how to conduct a risk assessment of their potential exposure. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> 1. Each facility should convene and charge a Surgical Review Committee (SRC), composed of surgery, anesthesiology, and nursing personnel, to provide defined, transparent, and responsive oversight of the prioritization of elective inpatient cases.<br /> 2. Facilities must test each patient within 72 hours of a scheduled procedure with a preoperative COVID-19 RT-PCR test and ensure COVID-19 negative status.<br /> 3. Facilities may resume procedures only if there is adequate personal protective equipment with respect to the number and type of procedures that will be performed, and enough to ensure adequate supply if COVID-19 activity increases in the community within the next 14 days.<br /> 4. Facility cleaning policies in all areas along the continuum of operative care must follow established infection control procedures.<br /> 5. Other areas of the facility that support perioperative services must be ready to commence operations with uniformly heightened infection control practices, including sterile processing, the clinical laboratory, and diagnostic imaging. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www2.illinois.gov/idol/FAQs/Pages/Employee-Sick-Leave-Act-FAQs.aspx"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-11 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="http://www.dph.illinois.gov/topics-services/diseases-and-conditions/diseases-a-z-list/coronavirus/business-guidance"> Business and Organization Guidance </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www2.illinois.gov/dceo/Documents/Essential%2520Business%2520FAQ.pdf"> Essential Buisnesses & Operations FAQs </a><a target="_blank" href="http://www.dph.illinois.gov/sites/default/files/COVID-19_WorkplaceHealth_SafetyGuidance20200505.pdf"> Workpace Health and Safety Guidance for Employees and Staff of Businesses </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Indiana')" data-value="17" class="collapsible">Indiana</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.in.gov/gov/files/Executive%20Order%2020-26%20Roadmap%20to%20Reopen.pdf" target="_blank"> Roadmap to Reopen </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.backontrack.in.gov/" target="_blank"> Back on Track Indiana </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now: <br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation Gyms in most counties; Pools, tennis and basketball courts in most counties; Campgrounds in most counties; Gyms in all counties; Pools, tennis and basketball courts in all counties; Campgrounds in all counties (Operate with a 50% capacity)<br /> 2. Industries Manufacturing, offices<br /> 3. Houses of worship (Operate with a 50% capacity)<br /> 4. Food and drink Restaurant dining (Indoor dining may operate with a 50% capacity)<br /> 5. Personal care Spas, salons, barbershops, tattoo parlors (Appointment only and wearing protective equipment)<br /> 6. Retail stores in all counties (Operate with a 75% capacity)<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Indiana is currently in stage 3 of a 5 stage reopening plan. All Indiana businesses should take measures and institute safeguards to ensure a safe environment for their employees, customers, and clients. This includes any business that has remained open during the Stay-at-Home order, as well as those opening to employees and customers in the coming days and weeks.<br /> The safeguards below are based on the recommendations of the CDC and OSHA guidelines should be followed. These are general safeguard protocols for businesses. In addition, all businesses shall provide employees, clients, and customers with a customized COVID-19 action plan that captures industry specific measures to ensure a safe workplace. This plan should be posted publicly and made available upon request. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Have a plan in place if an employee presents symptoms. Resources for testing are available in Indiana through medical providers and the OptumServe testing procedure. A list of testing sites may be found at: https://isdh.maps.arcgis.com/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=fa61af71d4474e62b2408647d1624817 Conduct daily health assessments by utilizing a screening procedure for COVID-19 symptoms for employees who are reporting for work. Examples include self-assessments before arrival in the workplace, screening questions, or taking temperatures with a no-touch thermometer. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Employee Screening Procedures - Conduct daily health assessments by utilizing a screening procedure for COVID-19 symptoms for employees who are reporting for work. Examples include self-assessments before arrival in the workplace, screening questions, or taking temperatures with a no-touch thermometer<br /> 2. Employees with Symptoms - Have a plan in place if an employee presents symptoms. Resources for testing are available in Indiana through medical providers and the OptumServe testing procedure<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Identify how personal equipment will be used in the workplace, including masks or face coverings or other protective gear. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Vulnerable Employees and Customers - Those 65 and over and individuals with identified high-risk conditions are particularly vulnerable to coronavirus. These individuals should continue remote work as much as possible and should refrain from visiting businesses as much as is possible.<br /> 2. Social Distancing - Mitigate exposure in the workplace by implementing social distancing guidelines. Ensure a minimum of 6 feet between people, which may be accomplished in a number of ways. Examples include physical barriers such as sneeze guards, limiting capacity, altering shifts, line markings,<br /> using appointments whenever possible, and limiting close interactions with customers.<br /> 3. Signage - Post signage about health policies and practices in common areas for employees and customers to see.<br /> 4. Remote Work - Continue to encourage remote work as much as possible. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Personal Hygiene - Ensure that employees, customers, and clients have ready access to hand sanitizer, handwashing stations, or other disinfectant products.<br /> 2. Signage - Post signage about health policies and practices in common areas for employees and customers to see. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Workplace Cleaning and Disinfection - Implement practices according to CDC guidelines, with regular cleaning of high-touch surfaces throughout the workday and at the close of business or between shifts.<br /> 2. Implement Plans for Positive COVID-19 Cases - Be in touch with your local health department and follow CDC guidelines to monitor COVID-19 cases and deep clean your facility.<br /> 3. Post signage about health policies and practices in common areas for employees and customers to see. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Employees with Symptoms - Have a plan in place if an employee presents symptoms. Resources for testing are available in Indiana through medical providers and the OptumServe testing procedure<br /> 2. Implement Plans for Positive COVID-19 Cases - Be in touch with your local health department and follow CDC guidelines to monitor COVID-19 cases and deep clean your facility<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Health care providers and facilities may resume elective medical procedures provided they have sufficient quantities of PPE and consult the best practices and recommendations developed by their medical associations or industries. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.dol.gov/agencies/whd/fmla/pandemic"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> Indiana is part of a Midwest coalition of states looking at reopening possibilities </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-11 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://backontrack.in.gov/files/BackOnTrack-IN_IndustryGuidelines-Businesses.pdf"> General Guidelines For All Businesses </a><a target="_blank" href="https://backontrack.in.gov/files/BackOnTrack-IN_IndustryGuidelines-OfficeSettings.pdf"> Office Settings </a><a target="_blank" href="https://backontrack.in.gov/2348.htm"> Back on Track IN </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
