<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Iowa')" data-value="18" class="collapsible">Iowa</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> No stay at home order </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://governor.iowa.gov/sites/default/files/documents/Public%20Health%20Proclamation%20-%202020.05.13.pdf" target="_blank"> Proclamation </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://idph.iowa.gov/Portals/1/userfiles/61/covid19/resources/IDPH%20Reopening%20Guidance%205_12_20.pdf" target="_blank"> IDPH Reopening Guidance </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Houses of worship<br /> 2. Entertainment Libraries; Movie theaters; Museums, zoos, aquariums; Casinos; Outdoor venues; Bowling alleys, amusement parks<br /> 3. Outdoor and recreation Campgrounds; Gyms; Pools; Playgrounds, skating rinks, skate parks (Operate with a 50% capacity of its maximum legal occupancy and maintain six-foot distancing)<br /> 4. Personal care Medical spas, tanning salons; Salons, barbershops, tattoo parlors, etc. (Operate with 50% capacity, appointment only, and maintain six-foot distancing between customers)<br /> 5. Food and drink Restaurant dining; Bars (Operate with a 50% capacity, limited to party size of 10, and maintain six-foot distancing)<br /> 6. Retail stores, malls (Operate with 50% capacity and maintain social distancing) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> 1. Follow CDC guidance related to Cleaning and Disinfection for Community Facilities, including frequent cleaning and disinfecting of all high touch surfaces. Refer to the CDC's Cleaning and Disinfection Tool to determine which areas need cleaning versus disinfection.<br /> 2. Encourage and provide supplies to allow for frequent hand washing and hand sanitizing for employees and the public.<br /> 3. Provide reminders to employees and members of the public to stay at least 6 feet away from others when in the facility and mark six foot intervals when possible.<br /> 4. Post signage at the door indicating no one should enter the establishment (including employees) if they currently have symptoms or have been around anyone with a confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis in the last 14 days.<br /> 5. If an employee or a member of the public becomes ill while at the facility, ask them to share that information with management, leave the facility and then call their health care provider. If it is an emergency, call 911 and let them know the emergency may be COVID-19 related.<br /> 6. Members of the public and employees should consider the use of cloth face coverings (when practical) if staying at least 6 feet away from others is not possible.<br /> 7. Anyone who is high risk for more severe COVID-19 illness should continue to stay home.<br /> 8. Businesses should continue to follow the CDC's guidance for businesses and ensure return to work policies for employees with positive diagnoses are consistent with CDC guidance regarding self isolation.<br /> 9. Businesses should also reach out to the Iowa Department of Public Health or the local public health department with questions at any time.<br /> 10. Businesses should also use messaging to remind employees of steps they should be taking to protect their own health while at work. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> If an employee or a member of the public becomes ill while at the facility, ask them to share that information with management, leave the facility and then call their health care provider. If it is an emergency, call 911 and let them know the emergency may be COVID-19 related. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Update sick leave policies with flexibility and non-punitive considerations in mind to encourage sick employees to stay home for themselves, children, or other family members;<br /> 2. Encourage employees to do daily self-assessments for COVID-19 symptoms;<br /> 3. Actively encourage sick employees to stay home until they are fever-free and symptoms have improved for at least 72 hours (three full days), and at least seven days have passed since symptoms first began;<br /> 4. Suspend the requirement for healthcare provider return-to-work notices;<br /> 5. Separate sick employees, send them home immediately, and restrict access until recovery; </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Members of the public and employees should consider the use of cloth face coverings (when practical) if staying at least 6 feet away from others is not possible. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Provide reminders to employees and members of the public to stay at least 6 feet away from others when in the facility and mark six foot intervals when possible. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Encourage and provide supplies to allow for frequent hand washing and hand sanitizing for employees and the public. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Follow CDC guidance related to Cleaning and Disinfection for Community Facilities, including frequent cleaning and disinfecting of all high touch surfaces. Refer to the CDC's Cleaning and Disinfection Tool to determine which areas need cleaning versus disinfection. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Elective surgeries to resume to the "new normal" </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.iowaworkforcedevelopment.gov/sites/search.iowaworkforcedevelopment.gov/files/content-files/Updated%20-UI%20Worker_COVID-19%20QA.pdf"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-11 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://idph.iowa.gov/Emerging-Health-Issues/Novel-Coronavirus/Guidance"> Reopening Guidance for Iowans </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Kansas')" data-value="19" class="collapsible">Kansas</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://governor.kansas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/EO-20-34-Implementing-Phase-2-Executed.pdf" target="_blank"> Executive Order No. 20-34 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://covid.ks.gov/ad-astra-a-plan-to-reopen-kansas/" target="_blank"> Ad Astra: A Plan to Reopen Kansas </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Food and drink Restaurant dining (Party limit size to 10, persons not living within the same household should sit different table, maintain six-foot distance, and operate with a 33% capacity)<br /> 2. Retail stores (Operate with a 33% capacity) <br /> 3. Houses of worship (Maintain a six-foot distance and operate with a 33% capacity)<br /> 4. Industries Offices (No more than 50% of employees are physically present in the office on any given day)<br /> 5. Personal care Salons, barbershops, tattoo parlors (Operate with a 33% capacity and when possible maintain a six-foot distance)<br /> 6. Outdoor and recreation Gyms; Community centers (Operate with a 33% capacity)<br /> 7. Entertainment Theaters, museums and bowling alleys (Operate with a 33% capacity)<br /> 8. Sports facilities; bars (Gatherings with 50 people or fewer and venues that hold 50 people or fewer) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Kansas is in phase 2 of a 5 step reopening plan (phase 1, phase 1.5, phase 2, phase 3, phase 4, and phase out). First and foremost, Kansas is dedicated to ensuring the safety of Kansas employers and workers. The United States Department of Labor (USDOL) Occupational Safety and Health Association (OSHA) provides practical guidance on how to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 at www.dol.gov/newsroom/releases/osha/osha20200309.<br /> <br /> 1. Monitor employees temperatures and symptoms regularly. Issue or approve face coverings. Be mindful of spaces where 6 feet of distance can't be maintained. Disinfect workspaces at the beginning and end of each shift/work day. <br /> <br /> 2. Maintain fundamental cleaning and public health practices. Maintain at least 6 feet of distance between consumers -- being mindful of areas such as check-outs and customer service areas. <br /> <br /> 3. Explore the guidance documents and toolkits on this website, and follow industry-specific guidelines outlined on covid.ks.gov. Find resources to print and share in the Publications section. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Actively encouraging sick employees to stay home and not to return to work until they have been symptom-free for at least 24 hours<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Individuals are strongly encouraged to wear cloth masks in public settings as appropriate. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Implementing flexible work sites (e.g., telework)<br /> 2. Implementing flexible work hours (e.g., staggered shifts)<br /> 3. Increasing physical space between employees at the worksite<br /> 4. Increasing physical space between employees and customers (e.g., drive through, partitions)<br /> 5. Implementing flexible meeting and travel options (e.g., postpone nonessential meetings or events)<br /> 6. Downsizing operations<br /> 7. Delivering services remotely (e.g., phone, video, or web)<br /> 8. Delivering products through curbside pick-up or delivery </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Emphasize staying home when sick, respiratory etiquette and hand hygiene by all employees:<br /> 1. Display educational materials that encourage staying home when sick, cough and sneeze etiquette, and hand hygiene at the entrance to your workplace and in other workplace areas where they are likely to be seen.<br /> 2. Provide tissues and no-touch disposal receptacles for use by employees.<br /> 3. Instruct employees to clean their hands often with an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60-95% alcohol or wash their hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Soap and water should be used preferentially if hands are visibly dirty.<br /> 4. Provide soap and water and alcohol-based hand rubs in the workplace. Ensure that adequate supplies are maintained. Place hand rubs in multiple locations or in conference rooms to encourage hand hygiene. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Routinely clean all frequently touched surfaces in the workplace, such as<br /> workstations, countertops, and doorknobs. Use the cleaning agents that are<br /> usually used in these areas and follow the directions on the label.<br /> 2. Provide disposable disinfectant wipes so that commonly used surfaces (for<br /> example, doorknobs, keyboards, remote controls, desks) can be wiped down by<br /> employees before each use.<br /> 3. Encourage social distancing and do not congregate in break rooms or crowded places.<br /> 4. Discourage the sharing of equipment like headsets and other similar items. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Employees who are well but who have a sick family member at home with COVID-19 should notify their supervisor and refer to KDHE guidance for how to conduct a risk assessment of their potential exposure.<br /> 2. If an employee is confirmed to have COVID-19, employers should inform fellow employees of their possible exposure to COVID-19 in the workplace but maintain confidentiality as required by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). Employees exposed to a co-worker with confirmed COVID-19 should refer to KDHE guidance for how to conduct a risk assessment of their potential exposure. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Depends on facility - most have resumed. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.dol.ks.gov/docs/default-source/default-document-library/ui-covid19-faqs.pdf"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-11 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://covid.ks.gov/reopen-page/"> Reopen Business Guidelines </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www.coronavirus.kdheks.gov/248/Business-Employers"> Business Employers - Operational Guidance </a><a target="_blank" href="https://covid.ks.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Reopen-Kansas-Framework-v6.2-5.19.20.pdf"> Detailed reopening plan by phase </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Kentucky')" data-value="20" class="collapsible">Kentucky</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://kentucky.gov/Pages/Activity-stream.aspx?n=GovernorBeshear&prId=148" target="_blank"> Gradual Reopening Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://govstatus.egov.com/ky-healthy-at-work" target="_blank"> Healthy at Work </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now: <br /> 1. Food and drink Restaurant dining (Party limit size to 10, persons not living within the same household should sit different table, maintain six-foot distance, and operate with a 33% capacity)<br /> 2. Retail stores (Operate with a 33% capacity) <br /> 3. Houses of worship (Maintain a six-foot distance and operate with a 33% capacity)<br /> 4. Industries Manufacturing, construction, offices (No more than 50% of employees are physically present in the office on any given day)<br /> 5. Personal care Salons, barbershops, tattoo parlors (Operate with a 33% capacity and when possible maintain a six-foot distance)<br /> 6. Outdoor and recreation Gyms; Community centers (Operate with a 33% capacity)<br /> 7. Entertainment Theaters, museums and bowling alleys (Operate with a 33% capacity)<br /> 8. Sports facilities; bars (Gatherings with 50 people or fewer and venues that hold 50 people or fewer) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> 1. Have conversations with employees about their concerns.<br /> 2. Develop other flexible policies for scheduling and telework (if feasible) and create leave policies to allow employees to stay home to care for sick family members or care for children if schools and childcare close.<br /> 3. Talk with companies that provide your business with contract or temporary employees about their plans. Discuss the importance of sick employees staying home and encourage them to develop non-punitive "emergency sick leave" policies.<br /> 4. Plan to implement practices to minimize face-to-face contact between employees if social distancing is recommended by your state or local health department. Actively encourage flexible work arrangements such as teleworking or staggered shifts.<br /> 5. Consider the need for travel and explore alternatives.<br /> 6. Provide education and training materials in an easy to understand format and in the appropriate language and literacy level for all employees, like fact sheets and posters.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Create a testing plan. Entities must ensure that any employee with COVID-19 symptoms is tested by a health care provider immediately. Entities must ensure that employees are trained on how to isolate individuals with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 and how to report possible cases. If an employee tests positive, the entities must immediately notify the local public health department. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. All businesses must assess employees each day to ensure that they do not have any COVID-19 symptoms. Businesses may choose whether to require: <br /> 1a. an in-person assessment at the beginning of each day, or; <br /> 1b. a self-screening that the employee conducts at least once every 24 hours and then reports the results to the business.<br /> 2. All businesses must assess employees each day to ensure they do not have a fever. Businesses may choose whether to require: <br /> 2a. on-site temperature screenings, or; <br /> 2b. self screenings conducted by the employees at home no more than one hour prior to arrival and reported to the employer prior to beginning work. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Universal Employee Masks: Businesses, organizations, and entities must ensure, to the greatest extent practicable, that their employees/volunteers/contractors wear a cloth mask<br /> 2. Businesses and organizations shall provide PPE at no cost to employees. <br /> 3. Encourage customers to wear masks, which entities may provide. Entities may refuse to serve any customer who is not wearing a mask.<br /> 4. Access to gloves, entities must ensure that employees whose job duties include touching items often touched by other wear gloves that are regularly replaced. <br /> 5. Should offer instruction on proper use of masks and PPE. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Continue telework where possible. Entities should operate via phone or Internet to the greatest extent practicable. Employees who are able to perform their job duties via telework (phone or Internet) must continue to telework.<br /> 2. Phased return to work. Entities are encouraged to implement a phased return to work, including generous telework, sick leave, and family leave policies for those employees who are not able to come into work due to illness, taking care of a family member(s), or lack of childcare options.<br /> 3. Enforce social distancing. Entities must ensure that employees who are not able to telework and must be physically present at the office remain a minimum of six (6) feet away from all other employees and customers unless closer interaction is absolutely required to perform their job duties (e.g., health care examinations).<br /> 4. Limit face-to-face interaction. Entities must ensure that employees minimize face-to-face contact with one another and with customers to the greatest extent practicable. Meetings should be conducted via telephone or Internet if possible.<br /> 5. Restrict Common Areas. Entities must, to the greatest extent practicable, restrict common areas such as lobbies, waiting rooms, break rooms, smoking areas, lunch rooms, and concession areas to maximize social distancing and reduce congregating </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Entities must supply adequate hand sanitizer (60% alcohol content or higher) for both employees and customers and ensure that it is made available near high-traffic and high-touch areas (e.g., doors or door handles). <br /> 2. Entities must also encourage routine and consistent hand washing for employees and customers. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific</strong><br> Fundamental cleaning and public health practices must be followed. Businesses should follow industry-specific guidelines as provided on covid.ks.gov. Any additional best practices guidance from each business sector is strongly encouraged. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Entities opened must be prepared to assist public health officials if an employee test positive or becomes exposed to COVID-19. This assistance includes, but is not limited to, providing the employee's work schedule, workstation, hours or shifts worked, when the employee was potentially exposed, and the names and contact information of any other employee or client is exposed to the virus. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> 1. All patients will be screened before; temperature taken upon arrival <br /> 2. Tested for the virus 48 hours before their procedure </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Recommended closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.kaco.org/en/county-information/covid-19-resources/county-guidance/sick-leave.aspx"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-12 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://govstatus.egov.com/ky-healthy-at-work"> Healthy at Work </a><a target="_blank" href="https://govsite-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/34CVrepQ8KClctVAQEDH_5-11-2020%2520CHFS%2520Order%2520Minimum%2520Requirements%2520for%2520All%2520Entities.pdf"> Minimum Requirements for All Entities </a><a target="_blank" href="https://govsite-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/0RSeJ0dKSGuSxgj4ZX3S_Healthy%2520at%2520Work%2520Reqs%2520-%2520Office-Based%2520Businesses%2520-%2520Final%2520Version%25201.0.pdf"> Office-Based Businesses (50%) </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Louisiana')" data-value="21" class="collapsible">Louisiana</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Phased reopening Plan </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://gov.louisiana.gov/index.cfm/newsroom/detail/2488" target="_blank"> Phase One </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://gov.louisiana.gov/assets/docs/covid/Roadmap-to-Resilient-Louisiana-FINAL.pdf" target="_blank"> Roadmap to Resilient Louisana </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Food and drink Restaurant dining; Bars with food licenses (Operate with 50% capacity)<br /> 2. Outdoor and recreation Gyms; State parks (Operate with 50% capacity)<br /> 3. Retail Malls (Operate with 50% capacity)<br /> 4. Entertainment Movie theaters; Certain museums, zoos and aquariums; Casinos<br /> 5. Personal care Salons and barbershops (Operate with 50% capacity)<br /> 6. Houses of worship (Operate with 50% capacity) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> 1. Register your business through the Open Safely link provided on this page. Your registration allows you to receive updated communication, notifications, and helpful guidance via email from the State Fire Marshal's Office specific to your business type. To begin receiving notifications and guidance for safely opening or operating your business, register your business, State Fire Marshal field personnel will be assisting owners statewide with their business openings and safe operation.<br /> 1a. Review checklist for both management and all staff.<br /> 2.Develop an Infectious Disease Preparedness and Response Plan<br /> 3. Prepare to Implement Basic Infection Prevention Measures<br /> 4. Develop Policies and Procedures for Prompt Identification and Isolation of Sick People, if Appropriate<br /> 5. Develop, Implement, and Communicate about Workplace Flexibilities and Protections<br /> 6. Follow existing OSHA Standards </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> In the event of confirmed or suspected COVID-19 cases, once recovered, employees should take temperature before work. Stay home if it is 100.4 degrees or more. Employers should measure the employees temperature and assess symptoms prior to<br /> them starting work. Ideally, temperature checks should happen before the individual.<br /> enters the facility. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> All employees dealing with the public must wear face masks. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> The maximum building capacity during the Phase 1 period is limited to 25% of the normal established capacity and is limited by social distancing requirements of 6 feet as outlined below. Please note that capacity restrictions should be applied down to the individual room, not just overall facilities.<br /> <br /> 1. Do not exceed the maximum building capacity of 25%: One person per 300 square feet of gross area; or 25% of the posted capacity by order of the State Fire Marshal. Exception: Where the two above factors reduce your capacity to below 10 persons, a 10-person minimum is allowed.<br /> 2. Make arrangements to allow for the minimum of 6 feet distance between occupants.<br /> 3. Reduce employee area capacity to allow for 6-foot distancing between employees.<br /> 4. Do not allow physical contact between employees and clients.<br /> 5. One occupant per private individual office is allowed.<br /> 6. Open office areas shall be arranged such that a minimum of 6 feet distance between other persons is maintained.<br /> 7. Conference rooms shall be limited to a maximum of 10 persons. A 6-foot distance shall be maintained within the conference room between unrelated small groups.<br /> 8. Break rooms shall be limited to temporary access by one employee at a time.<br /> 9. Teleworking of employees should continue wherever and whenever possible.<br /> 10. Do not permit interior waiting areas. Waiting may be provided outside of the facility while following social distancing guidelines or persons shall wait in cars.<br /> 11. Avoid gatherings in the building while entering, exiting, or moving about. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Frequent handwashing is the most important hand hygiene that can be done to stop the spread of COVID-19. Gloves are recommended when touching products, goods, money and credit cards but are otherwise not recommended for tasks that do not normally require gloves. If gloves are worn:<br /> 2. Hands should be washed before putting gloves on and after removing gloves.<br /> 3. Gloves should be changed often, changed between tasks, changed when they are obviously soiled, and changed after each interaction with a new individual.<br /> 4. If gloves are not available, use hand sanitizer between each task and after client interaction. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Clean and sanitize items you touch often.<br /> 2. Clean and sanitize desks and counters, as well as surfaces that clients touch often, like doorknobs, handles, plates, light switches, countertops, refrigerators and freezer door handles, etc. Current evidence suggests that SARS-CoV-2 may remain viable for hours to days on surfaces made from a variety of materials. Cleaning of visibly dirty surfaces, as well as high-touch surfaces, followed by disinfection is a best practice measure for prevention of COVID-19 and other viral respiratory illnesses in community settings. Follow the CDC guidance for proper cleaning and disinfecting. https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/organizations/cleaningdisinfection.html<br /> 3. Clean and disinfect the restrooms regularly.<br /> 4. Do not touch the clients.<br /> <br /> Steps for Cleaning Areas and Other Items<br /> 5. First, clean the area or item with soap and water or another detergent if it is dirty.<br /> 6. Then, use disinfectant.<br /> 7. If possible, use EPA-registered household disinfectant.<br /> 8. Follow the instructions on the label to ensure safe and effective use of the product.<br /> <br /> Many products recommend:<br /> 9. Keeping surfaces wet for a period of time (see product label).<br /> 10. Precautions such as wearing gloves and making sure you have good ventilation<br /> during use of the product.<br /> 11. Diluted household bleach solutions may also be used if appropriate for the surface.<br /> 12. Check the label to see if your bleach is intended for disinfection and ensure the product is not past its expiration date. Some bleaches, such as those designed for safe use on colored clothing or for whitening, may not be suitable for disinfection.<br /> 13. Unexpired household bleach will be effective against coronaviruses when properly diluted.<br /> 14. Follow manufacturer's instructions for application and proper ventilation. Never mix household bleach with ammonia or any other cleanser.<br /> 15. Leave the solution on the surface for at least 1 minute.<br /> 16. To make a bleach solution, mix: 5 tablespoons (1/3rd cup) of bleach per gallon of water; or 4 teaspoons of bleach per quart of water. Alcohol solutions with at least 70% alcohol may also be used.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Sick individuals stay home, isolate from household contacts, and contact medical providers<br /> 2. A person who had COVID-19 symptoms and were directed to care for themselves at home may end self-isolation and return to work when at least 3 days (72 hours) have passed since recovery and meet the following three requirements:<br /> 2a. Have been fever free without using fever-reducing medications, and show improvement in respiratory symptoms including no longer coughing or having shortness of breath, and<br /> 2b. It has been at least 10 days since symptoms first appeared. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Has resumed following CMS guidelines: https://www.cms.gov/files/document/cms-non-emergent-elective-medical-recommendations.pdf </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.louisianalawblog.com/uncategorized/coronavirus-leave-bill-signed-into-law/"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-12 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://gov.louisiana.gov/assets/docs/covid/Roadmap-to-Resilient-Louisiana-FINAL.pdf"> Roadmap to Resilient Louisana </a><a target="_blank" href="https://gov.louisiana.gov/can-this-business-open/"> Can this business open? </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Maine')" data-value="22" class="collapsible">Maine</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Phased reopening Plan </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.maine.gov/governor/mills/sites/maine.gov.governor.mills/files/inline-files/An%20Order%20to%20Stay%20Safer%20at%20Home.pdf" target="_blank"> Stay Safer at Home Executive Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.maine.gov/covid19/sites/maine.gov.covid19/files/inline-files/Restarting_Maines_Economy_Book.pdf" target="_blank"> Restarting Maine's Economy </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now: <br /> 1. Personal care Hair salons, barbershops, pet groomers (Appointment only)<br /> 2. Outdoor and recreation State parks, boating, golf courses; Remote campgrounds, hunting and fishing; Private campgrounds, RV parks (10 person limit and maintain social distancing)<br /> 3. Food and drink Restaurants in all counties<br /> 4. Retail in all counties (Operate with 40% capacity of the store's legal occupancy or eight individuals per 1,000 sq ft along with other social distancing and hygiene guidelines)<br /> 5. Houses of worship (Up to 50 people allowed and maintain physical distancing and hygiene) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> 1. Develop other flexible policies for scheduling and telework (if feasible) and create leave policies to allow employees to stay home to care for sick family members or care for children if schools and childcare close.<br /> 2. Plan to implement practices to minimize face-to-face contact between employees if social distancing is recommended by your state or local health department. Actively encourage flexible work arrangements such as teleworking or staggered shifts.<br /> 3. Consider the need for travel and explore alternatives.<br /> 4. Develop other flexible policies for scheduling and telework (if feasible) and create leave policies to allow employees to stay home to care for sick family members or care for children if schools and childcare close.<br /> 5. Provide education and training materials in an easy to understand format and in the appropriate language and literacy level for all employees, like fact sheets and posters.<br /> 6. Have conversations with employees about their concerns. Some employees may be at higher risk for severe illness, such as older adults and those with chronic medical conditions. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Know the signs and symptoms of COVID-19. Know what to do if staff become symptomatic at the workplace.<br /> 1. Encourage employees to stay home and notify workplace administrators when sick (workplaces should provide non-punitive sick leave options to allow staff to stay home when ill).<br /> 2. Review, update, or develop workplace plans to include leave policies for people with COVID-19 symptoms.<br /> 3. When an employee feels ill, instruct employees to not come to work with symptoms of COVID-like illness. Symptoms may appear 2-14 days after exposure to the virus. People with these symptoms or combinations of symptoms may have COVID-19: Cough, shortness of breath or difficulty breathing, or at least two of these symptoms: Fever, chills, repeated shaking with chills, muscle pain, headache, sore throat, new loss of taste or smell<br /> 4. Have a plan for a room or space where the employee can be isolated until transferred to home or health care facility and provide a facemask, if available and tolerated. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Cloth face coverings are required for anyone except: children under age 2, a child in a child care setting, or for anyone who has trouble breathing or related medical conditions, or who is otherwise unable to remove the mask without assistance. <br /> 2. Construction firms should deploy additional Personal Protective Equipment and other safety measures on job sites. <br /> <br /> Recommended: <br /> 1. Ensure that employees have access to hand soap, cloth face coverings, gloves, tissues, paper towels, and a designated trash bin to dispose of used items. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Consider staggered work shifts and expanding hours to reduce number of individuals working together at the same time and spread out the contact with members of the public.<br /> 2. Maintain 6 feet physical distancing for staff, customers, and vendors.<br /> 3. Face-to-face staff meetings should be limited and respect physical distancing.<br /> 4. Increase electronic workplace communications (texts, emails, instant messaging, phone calls) with staff to reduce frequent face-to-face contact.<br /> 5. Adjust break/meal times to limit contact between employees.<br /> 6. Use posters to remind staff, vendors, and customers regarding hand hygiene and physical distancing.<br /> 7. Employees with disabilities that put them at high risk for complications of COVID-19 may request telework as a reasonable accommodation to reduce their chances of infection during a pandemic. Employers should make workplaces as safe as possible for workers. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Ensure that employees have access to hand soap, cloth face coverings, gloves, tissues, paper towels, and a designated trash bin to dispose of used items.<br /> 2. Provide access to hand washing areas for staff, vendors, and customers.<br /> 3. Provide hand sanitizer (at least 60% alcohol) in multiple locations around work and public spaces.<br /> 4. Please avoid greeting others by shaking hands.<br /> 5. Provide resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene such as tissues, no-touch trash cans, hand soap, alcohol-based hand rubs containing at least 60 percent alcohol, disinfectants, and disposable towels for workers to clean their work surfaces. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Provide resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene such as tissues, no-touch trash cans, hand soap, alcohol-based hand rubs containing at least 60 percent alcohol, disinfectants, and disposable towels for workers to clean their work surfaces. <br /> 2. Ventilate workspace with open windows and doors to the extent possible.<br /> 3. Disinfect phones, shared tools, scanning devices, and other shared items regularly.<br /> 4. Discourage shared use of desks, offices, or phones. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. If an employee displays symptoms at work, have a plan for a room or space where the employee can be isolated until transferred to home or health care facility and provide a facemask, if available and tolerated.<br /> 2. Call 911 for guidance/assistance.<br /> 3. Notify personnel who came into contact with ill person of their possible exposure to COVID-19 in the workplace, but should maintain confidentiality as required by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).<br /> 4. Know the current CDC guidance for employee infected by COVID<br /> 5. Have a plan for members of the public who become ill while at your business. Follow steps above. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Elective health care from Maine licensed providers has resumed, with a recommendation that they prioritize care for patients with time-sensitive conditions, assure the safety of patients, staff, and communities, manage the use of essential resources such as personal protective equipment and testing supplies, and pace reopening services to the level of community COVID-19 activity, maintaining capacity in our hospitals as needed. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Recommended closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.maine.gov/labor/docs/2020/COVID-19Resources.pdf"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> Maine is in touch with neighbors New Hampshire and Vermont on reopening measures </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-12 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.maine.gov/decd/covid-19-prevention-checklists"> Prevention Checklist </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www.maine.gov/covid19/sites/maine.gov.covid19/files/inline-files/Restarting%2520Maines%2520Economy%2520SAMPLE%2520CAR%2520DEALERSHIP%2520CHECKLIST.pdf"> General Guidance </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www.maine.gov/covid19/restartingmaine"> Restarting Maine </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Maryland')" data-value="23" class="collapsible">Maryland</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://governor.maryland.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Gatherings-FIFTH-AMENDED-5.6.20.pdf" target="_blank"> Stay at Home Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://governor.maryland.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/MD_Strong.pdf" target="_blank"> Maryland Strong Roadmap to Recovery </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation Golf courses, outdoor shooting ranges, marinas, campgrounds; Beaches; Outdoor pools and day camps (Maintain six-foot distancing and no more than 10 people)<br /> 2. Retail stores (Operate with a 50% capacity)<br /> 3. Industries Manufacturing (Operate with a 50% capacity)<br /> 4. Houses of worship (Operate with a 50% capacity with outdoor services encouraged)<br /> 5. Personal care Hair salons, barbershops (Operate with a 50% capacity and by appointment only)<br /> 6. Food and drink Restaurants open for outdoor dining; Outdoor service at breweries, wineries, and distilleries (Outdoor seating) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> 1. Prepare your reopening and operating plan according to CDC guidance and OSHA guidance.<br /> 2. Prepare your physical facility for buildings that have not been occupied, check HVAC systems and flush the water system.<br /> 3. Communicate your COVID-19 policies clearly to everyone, including signage for staff and visitors.<br /> 4. Arrange visitor and employee spacing and traffic to maintain 6 foot separation wherever possible, and prevent crowding.<br /> 5. Screen employees for COVID-19 symptoms at start of work.<br /> 6. Be aware of employees with higher risk for severe disease and consider moving them to areas of lower risk.<br /> 7. Clean and disinfect the facility according to CDC guidance<br /> 8. Ensure that sick leave policies are flexible and consistent with State and Federal law.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Implement a daily screening process for workers which includes CDC or MDH recommended health questions, and consider temperature testing </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Employees and customers should wear face masks/facial coverings where applicable or required. Consider additional PPE equipment based on recommendations from your specific industry.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Have employees work or access the business from home whenever possible<br /> 2. Create proper markings/crowd control for spacing and signage to prohibit congregating in waiting spaces or check out spaces<br /> 3. Online ordering and curbside pickup should be continued and encouraged<br /> 4. Offer curbside pick up for ancillary products<br /> 5. Prepare guidance on store capacity, how customers queue in and outside of the store, and curbside pickup. Be mindful of creating situations that might cause lines and crowds </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> 1. Make hand sanitizer, disinfecting wipes, soap and water, or similar disinfectant readily available to employees and customers to use on surfaces that they may touch<br /> 2. Where possible, implement and encourage touchless payment </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Clean and disinfect the facility according to CDC guidance </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Direct sick workers to follow CDC and state guidelines regarding home isolation for suspected or confirmed COVID infections. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Has resumed as of 5/6 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.dllr.state.md.us/employment/uicovidfaqs.shtml"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-08 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://commerce.maryland.gov/Documents/BusinessResource/General-Business-COVID-19-Best-Practices.pdf"> General Business Best Practices to Reopen </a><a target="_blank" href="https://open.maryland.gov/backtobusiness/"> Back to Business </a><a target="_blank" href="https://governor.maryland.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Gatherings-FIFTH-AMENDED-5.6.20.pdf"> Executive Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Massachusetts')" data-value="24" class="collapsible">Massachusetts</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.mass.gov/news/safer-at-home-advisory" target="_blank"> Safer at Home Advisory </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.mass.gov/info-details/reopening-massachusetts" target="_blank"> Reopening: Four-Phased Approach </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation Golf courses; Beaches, parks, fishing, hunting and boating (Maintain six-foot distancing as you move around and your set up should be twelve-feet away)<br /> 2. Houses of worship (Operate with 40% capacity and maintain six-foot distancing)<br /> 3. Industries Construction, manufacturing; Offices<br /> 4. Retail for curbside pickup (Curbside encouraged before coming into the store if service is offered otherwise maintain six-foot social distancing)<br /> 5. Personal care Hair salons, barbershops; Pet grooming (Maintain six-foot distancing and limited to hair services; haircuts, color, blow drying, and treatments) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> In order to reopen, businesses must develop a written COVID-19 Control Plan outlining how its workplace will prevent the spread of COVID-19. Required materials are located on mass.gov/reopening, and include the COVID-19 Control Plan Template, Compliance Attestation Poster, and other posters for the workers. Please see below: <br /> <br /> 1. Businesses may complete a template, available on the mass.gov/reopening, to fulfill this requirement. This plan does no need to be submitted to a state agency for approval, but must be retained on the premises of the business and be provided in the event of an inspection.<br /> 2. Compliance Attestation Poster: businesses are required to sign a poster, attesting that they have completed a COVID-19 control plan, and post it in an area within the business premises that is visible to employees and visitors.<br /> 3. Other Posters: businesses are required to post signs and posters describing the rules for maintaining social distancing, hygiene protocols, cleaning, and disinfecting. <br /> 4. Provide training for employees regarding the social distancing and hygiene protocols.<br /> 5. Establish a plan for employees getting ill from COVID-19 at work, and a return-to-work plan.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> All employers should have employees self-screening at home, including temperature or symptom checks. Workers must stay home if feeling ill.<br /> <br /> More guidance given on an industry level please visit https://www.mass.gov/resource/reopening-sector-specific-protocols-and-best-practices for more information.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Require face coverings or masks for all employees </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. No handshaking.<br /> 2. A "No Congregation" policy is in effect, individuals must implement social distancing by maintaining a minimum distance of 6-feet from other individuals.<br /> 3. Avoid face to face meetings - critical situations requiring in-person discussion must follow social distancing.<br /> 4. Conduct all meetings via conference calls, if possible. 5. Do not convene meetings of more than 10 people. <br /> 6. Recommend use of cell phones, texting, web meeting sites and conference calls for project discussion.<br /> 7. All individual work crew meetings/tailgate talks should be held outside and follow social distancing. Please keep all crews a minimum of 6' apart at all times to eliminate the potential of cross contamination.<br /> 8. At each job briefing/tool box talk, employees are asked if they are experiencing any symptoms, and are sent home if they are.<br /> 9. Each jobsite should have laminated COVID-19 safety guidelines and hand washing instructions.<br /> 10. Please maintain Social Distancing separation during breaks and lunch.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Provide hand washing capabilities throughout the workplace.<br /> 2. Wash hands often with soap for at least 20 seconds or use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% ethanol or 70% isopropyl.<br /> 3. Cover coughing or sneezing with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash and wash hands, if no tissue is available then cough into your elbow.<br /> 4. Avoid touching eyes, nose, and mouth with your hands.<br /> 5. To avoid sharing germs, please clean up after yourself.<br /> 6. DO NOT make others responsible for moving, unpacking and packing up your personal belongings. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Each jobsite should develop cleaning and decontamination procedures that are posted and shared. These Procedures must cover all areas including trailers, gates, equipment, vehicles, etc. and shall be posted at all entry points to the sites, and throughout the project site.<br /> 2. All restroom facilities/porta-potties should be cleaned and handwashing stations must be provided with soap, hand sanitizer and paper towels<br /> 3. All surfaces should be regularly cleaned, including surfaces, door handles, laptops, etc.<br /> 4. All common areas and meeting areas are to be regularly cleaned and disinfected at least once a day but preferably twice a day<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Employees in quarantine, due to exposure to a known case of COVID-19 or someone with COVID-19 like illness, must remain under quarantine for 14 days since day of exposure and not report to work. Employers must have an isolation, contact tracing, and communication plan for if an worker is diagnosed as positive with COVID-19, or comes into close contact (within 6 feet for 10 minutes or more) with an individual diagnosed with COVID-19 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Depends on Facility</strong><br> Set to resume following CMS guidelines. All hospitals are to adhere to guidance published by the Massachusetts Department of Public Health regarding the scheduling, cancellation, and performance of non-essential elective invasive procedures. The guidance recommends that providers use their clinical judgment on a case-by-case basis and consider the preservation of the patient's life and health. The guidance does not apply to the cancellation or delay of life sustaining care. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.mass.gov/doc/covid-19-fld-faqs/download"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Massachusetts and Delaware will form a joint task force to plan for reopening the economy </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-09 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.mass.gov/info-details/reopening-mandatory-safety-standards-for-workplaces"> Reopening: Mandatory Safety Standards for Workplaces </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Michigan')" data-value="25" class="collapsible">Michigan</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.michigan.gov/whitmer/0,9309,7-387-90499_90705-531123--,00.html" target="_blank"> Executive Order No. 2020-114 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.michigan.gov/documents/coronavirus/MI_Safe_Start_Plan_5.7.20_689873_7.pdf" target="_blank"> MI Safe Start </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation Golf courses, marinas (Maintain six-foot distancing, protective gear required, and limit sharing of equipment)<br /> 2. Industries Construction, real estate; Manufacturing, including auto companies; Offices (Protective equipment required and reduce congestion in common spaces)<br /> 3. Food and drink Restaurants in certain counties; Bars in certain counties (Operate with 50% capacity and six-foot distance between parties or groups at different tables)<br /> 4. Retail (Maintain six-foot distancing and operate at 25% capacity for stores less than 50,000 sq ft and stores more than must limit the number of customers to 4 people per 1,000 sq ft, and 2 hours of shopping time designated only to the vulnerable population)<br /> 5. Medical Veterinary services statewide<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> All businesses or operations that require their employees to leave the homes or residences for work must, at a minimum:<br /> 1. Develop a COVID-19 preparedness and response plan, consistent with recommendations in Guidance on Preparing Workplaces for COVID-19, developed by the Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA). Within two weeks of resuming in-person activities, a businesss plan must be made readily available to employees, labor unions, and customers.<br /> 2. Designate one or more worksite supervisors to implement, monitor, and report on the COVID-19 control strategies developed under subsection (a). The supervisor must remain on-site at all times when employees are present on site. An on-site employee may be designated to perform the supervisory role.<br /> 3. Provide COVID-19 training to employees that covers, at a minimum: <br /> a. Workplace infection-control practices.<br /> b. The proper use of personal protective equipment.<br /> c. Steps the employee must take to notify the business or operation of any symptoms of COVID-19 or a suspected or confirmed diagnosis of COVID-19.<br /> d. How to report unsafe working conditions.<br /> The following are minimum guidelines that apply to all workplaces. Some workplaces, dependent on industry and risk level, may have stricter regulations. Please visit the link below for more information. <br /> https://www.michigan.gov/whitmer/0,9309,7-387-90499_90705-531123--,00.html<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Not Required</strong><br> 1. Follow recommendations for return to work, including not requiring a doctor note or test result to return. 2. Due to prioritization of specimen testing supplies, healthcare providers are not able to order tests for work clearance. 3. Testing capacity: if we are able to ensure that the individuals at risk in each re-engagement phase have access to testing when needed, we will be able to give individuals the information they need to stay safe and, at the same time, allow us to closely track the impact of re-engagement activities on our case growth. If we do not have this testing capacity, it will be harder to give our people and our decision-makers the information they need. 4. Tracing and containment effectiveness: if we are able to quickly follow up on any newly identified cases and associated contacts, and if those individuals effectively self-isolate, we can more successfully contain any new increase in disease spread. Otherwise, transmission is likely to be higher, increasing our risk. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Conduct a daily entry self-screening protocol for all employees or contractors entering the workplace, including, at a minimum, a questionnaire covering symptoms and suspected or confirmed exposure to people with possible COVID-19. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Provide non-medical grade face coverings to their employees, with supplies of N95 masks and surgical masks reserved, for now, for health care professionals, first responders (e.g., police officers, fire fighters, paramedics), and other critical workers.<br /> 2. Require face coverings to be worn when employees cannot consistently maintain six feet of separation from other individuals in the workplace, and consider face shields when employees cannot consistently maintain three feet of separation from other individuals in the workplace. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Keep everyone on the worksite premises at least six feet from one another to the maximum extent possible, including through the use of ground markings, signs, and physical barriers, as appropriate to the worksite. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Make cleaning supplies available to employees upon entry and at the worksite and provide time for employees to wash hands frequently or to use hand sanitizer. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Increase facility cleaning and disinfection to limit exposure to COVID-19, especially on high-touch surfaces (e.g., door handles), paying special attention to parts, products, and shared equipment (e.g., tools, machinery, vehicles).<br /> 2. Adopt protocols to clean and disinfect the facility in the event of a positive COVID-19 case in the workplace.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. When an employee is identified with a confirmed case of COVID-19, within 24 hours, notify both the local public health department<br /> 2. Notify any co-workers, contractors, or suppliers who may have come into contact with the person with a confirmed case of COVID-19.<br /> 3. An employer will allow employees with a confirmed or suspected case of COVID-19 to return to the workplace only after they are no longer infectious according to the latest guidelines from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention ("CDC").<br /> 4. Follow Executive Order 2020-36, and any executive orders that follow it, that prohibit discharging, disciplining, or otherwise retaliating against employees who stay home or who leave work when they are at particular risk of infecting others with COVID-19.<br /> 5. Establish a response plan for dealing with a confirmed infection in the workplace, including protocols for sending employees home and for temporary closures of all or part of the worksite to allow for deep cleaning.<br /> 6. Restrict business-related travel for employees to essential travel only.<br /> 7. Encourage employees to use personal protective equipment and hand sanitizer on public transportation.<br /> 8. Promote remote work to the fullest extent possible.<br /> 9. Adopt any additional infection-control measures that are reasonable in light of the work performed at the worksite and the rate of infection in the surrounding community. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong></strong><br> Postponed through May; order has been extended. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.natlawreview.com/article/michigan-governor-expands-covid-19-paid-medical-leave-rights-and-anti-retaliation"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-16 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.michigan.gov/documents/whitmer/MI_SAFE_START_PLAN_689875_7.pdf"> MI Safe Start Plan: Controlling Spread in the Workplace </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www.michigan.gov/documents/leo/Workplace_Guidelines_Factsheet-Employers_REV_692368_7.pdf"> Workplace Guidelines for Employers </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www.michigan.gov/whitmer/0,9309,7-387-90499_90705-531123--,00.html"> Executive Order 2020-114 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Minnesota')" data-value="26" class="collapsible">Minnesota</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://mn.gov/covid19/assets/EO%2020-74%20Final_tcm1148-434905.pdf" target="_blank"> Executive Order 20-74 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://mn.gov/covid19/for-minnesotans/stay-safe-mn/stay-safe-plan.jsp" target="_blank"> Minnesota's Stay Safe Plan </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Food and drink Restaurant dining (no more than ten (10) people at a single table, are properly adhered to. The continued use of drive-thru, pickup, or delivery options is encouraged)<br /> 2. Personal care Salons, barbershops, tattoo parlors, etc. (Follow general preventative guidelines in addition to any guidance provided by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). <br /> 3. Retail stores (For smaller locations (less than 10,000 square feet), they must maintain 25 percent or less of the authorized occupancy; For larger locations (10,000 square feet or greater), they must maintain 10 percent or less of the authorized occupancy.)<br /> 4. Outdoor and recreation Gyms; Campgrounds (limited number of participants, modified activities, restructured programs, and increased sanitization measures for facilities and participants.)<br /> 5. Entertainment Movie theaters, music venues, etc. (Maintain social distancing guidelines) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Non-Critical Sector businesses and employers must develop and implement a COVID-19 Preparedness Plan prior to reopening. Businesses must ensure the Plan is evaluated, monitored, executed, and updated under the supervision of a designated Plan Administrator. Employers must ensure the Plan is posted at all of the business's workplaces in readily accessible locations that will allow for the Plan to be readily reviewed by all workers, as required.<br /> <br /> By June 29, Critical Sector businesses are also required to develop and implement a COVID-19 Preparedness Plan.<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Employers should establish health screening protocols for workers at the start of each shift (e.g. health screening survey, taking temperature). <br /> <br /> Minnesota Visitor and Employee Health Screening Checklist can be found here, https://www.health.state.mn.us/diseases/coronavirus/facilityhlthscreen.pdf. You may also opt to conduct temperature screening if it can be done with proper social distancing, protection, and hygiene protocols. However, temperature screening is not required. Health screening questions include: <br /> <br /> Have you had any of the following symptoms since your last day at work or the last time you were here that you cannot attribute to another health condition?<br /> Please answer Yes or No to each question. Do you have:<br /> Fever or feeling feverish?<br /> Chills?<br /> A new cough?<br /> Shortness of breath?<br /> A new sore throat?<br /> New muscle aches?<br /> New headache?<br /> New loss of smell or taste?<br /> <br /> If a worker or visitor answers Yes to any of the screening questions, they should be advised to go home, stay away from other people, and contact their health care provider.<br /> <br /> <br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Require the use of source control face coverings (e.g. cloth face coverings). <br /> 2. Provide recommended protective supplies, such as non-medical cloth face coverings, gloves, disinfectant,etc. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Maximize remote-working - Workers who are able to work from home must work from home.<br /> 2. Stagger shifts and breaks; Extend work hours and create additional shifts to reduce number of workers per shift.<br /> 3. Evaluate traffic patterns and "choke points" to reduce crowding at entrances, in hallways, elevators, waiting areas, break areas, common areas, etc.<br /> 4. Limit collective gatherings of workers to 10 people or less.<br /> 5. Limit the number of people in restrooms.<br /> 6. Ensure physical distancing in work areas, including at workstations, productions lines, break rooms, etc.<br /> 7. Limit worker interaction across floors, buildings, campuses, worksites, etc. unless at least 6-foot distance is maintained.<br /> 8. Increase physical space between workers and clients/customers (e.g. drive-thru, partitions). </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Ensure workers regularly wash their hands. Ensure handwashing and/or hand-sanitizer facilities are readily available and appropriately stocked.<br /> 2. Provide recommended protective supplies, such as non-medical cloth face coverings, gloves, disinfectant, guards, shields, etc.<br /> 3. Post "hand-washing" and "cover your cough" signs.<br /> 4. Doors to multi-stall restrooms should be able to be opened and closed without touching the handles, opening-devices, or powered door-operators with the hand, whenever possible.
