If the door cannot be opened without touching the handle or door-operator with the hand, the business must ensure a trash-receptacle is placed by the door to ensure a paper towel can be readily disposed of when operating the door. The location and positioning of waste-receptacles should not interfere with Life Safety requirements (e.g. egress, evacuation, emergency equipment) or any reasonable accommodations provided under the Americans with Disabilities Act.<br /> 5. Community drinking stations and water-fountains should not be available/used. Touchless water-filling stations may still be provided.<br /> 6. Food should not be shared communally.<br /> 7. Provide tissues for proper cough/sneeze etiquette and no-touch disposal bins. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required </strong><br> 1. Establish a documented sanitation schedule and checklist, identifying surfaces/equipment to be sanitized, the agent to be used, and the frequency at which sanitation occurs.<br /> 2. Routinely clean and disinfect all areas, such as offices, restrooms, locker and changing rooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment, machinery, tools, controls, etc.<br /> 3. Frequently clean all high-touch items, such as doorknobs, countertops, barriers, railings, handles, and other surfaces.<br /> 4. Electronic devices (e.g. light-switches, circuit-breakers) should not be sanitized with a liquid agent. Consider covering switches/devices with a poly-covering that allows the user to manipulate the device without touching the switch, and change out the poly-covering frequently. Electronic devices must be sanitized only when disconnected from the power-source and sanitized in accordance with the listing/labeling requirements.<br /> 5. Personal equipment, tools and phones should not be shared or, if shared, should be disinfected after each use.<br /> 6. Implement immediate cleaning and disinfecting of the workplace if a worker, client or visitor becomes ill with COVID-19. See CDC's Cleaning and Disinfecting Your Facility (www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/disinfecting-building-facility.html).<br /> 7. Select appropriate and ensure the needed supply of disinfectants - consider effectiveness and safety. The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) List N has identified a list of products that meet EPA's criteria for use against SARS-CoV-2. See EPA's List N: Disinfectants for Use Against SARS-CoV-2 (www.epa.gov/pesticideregistration/list-n-disinfectants-use-against-sars-cov-2).<br /> 8. Review product labels and Safety Data Sheets, follow manufacturer specifications, and use required personal protective equipment for the product. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Workers with COVID-19 symptoms should be sent home immediately. If they cannot be sent home immediately, isolate in a closed room until they can be sent home. Workers who have been in close contact with a household member with COVID should not be at work until their quarantine period is finished. <br /> 2. Establish communication protocols and steps to take when workers have been exposed to COVID-19 in the workplace.<br /> 3. Designate an individual to maintain communication with and gather information from workers who may be ill, as to ensure the privacy of workers is maintained.<br /> 4. Establish worker sickness reporting protocols.<br /> 5. Establish protocols for workers to return to work, and follow MDH Guidance. (www.health.state.mn.us/diseases/coronavirus/returntowork.pdf).<br /> 6. Establish a process to identify contact between infected workers and other workers who may have been exposed. (CDC Interim Guidance for Businesses and Employers Responding to Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19), May 2020 (www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/guidance-businessresponse.html). </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Executive Order issued 5-10-20 lifted restrictions on elective procedures </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.health.state.mn.us/diseases/coronavirus/businesses.html"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-16 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://mn.gov/deed/newscenter/covid/safework/safe-reopening/"> Safely Returning to Work </a><a target="_blank" href="https://mn.gov/covid19/assets/EO%2020-74%20Final_tcm1148-434905.pdf"> Executive Order 20-74 </a><a target="_blank" href="http://www.dli.mn.gov/sites/default/files/pdf/employer_preparedness_plan_requirements_checklist.pdf"> Employer Preparedness Plan Requirements </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Mississippi')" data-value="27" class="collapsible">Mississippi</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1496.pdf" target="_blank"> Executive Order No. 1496 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/f0aaec97-bda1-4120-9b8d-c7f77f2dbd0c/Executive_Order_1492_Safe_Return.pdf" target="_blank"> Safe Return Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Retail stores (Operate with 50% capacity)<br /> 2. Food and drink Restaurant dining, bars (Operate with 50% capacity, maintain six-foot distancing)<br /> 3. Outdoor and recreation State parks; Gyms (Gyms to close by 10 pm to public each day, maintain six-foot distance, and all commone areas remain closed)<br /> 4. Personal care Salons and barbershops; Tattoo parlors (Maintain six-foot distance between chairs adn only one customer per employee allowed in barbershop)<br /> 5. Entertainment Casinos; Movie theaters; Libraries, museums (Operate with 50% capacity with restrictions) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> All employees must be provided training on how to limit the spread of COVID-19.<br /> <br /> Industry-specific signage must be posted at entrances to facilities regarding restrictions to customers with a fever or COVID-19 symptoms.<br /> <br /> The following are minimum guidelines that apply to all workplaces. Some workplaces, dependent on industry and risk level, may have stricter regulations. Please visit the links for more information, https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/f0aaec97-bda1-4120-9b8d-c7f77f2dbd0c/Executive_Order_1492_Safe_Return.pdf and https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1496.pdf. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. All employees shall be required to report any symptoms of COVID-19 to their supervisor.<br /> 2. Any employee exhibiting symptoms of COVID-19 during their shift shall be sent home immediately.<br /> 3. Daily screening of employees and volunteers for COVID-19 related symptoms before beginning shift is recommended.<br /> Such screening shall include the following questions:<br /> a. Have you been in close contact with a confirmed case of COVID-19 in the past 14 days?<br /> b. Are you experiencing a cough, shortness of breath, or sore throat?<br /> c. Have you had a fever in the last 48 hours?<br /> d. Have you had new loss of taste or smell?<br /> e. Have you had vomiting or diarrhea in the last 24 hours?<br /> Additional guidance given on industry-specific levels can be found in Executive Orders 1480, 1486, 1491, linked here https://www.sos.ms.gov/Education-Publications/Pages/Executive-Orders.aspx. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Employees must wear masks or face coverings when in contact with the public. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Businesses and nonprofit entities shall take all reasonable measures to ensure compliance with MSDH and CDC regulations including but not limited to, social distancing.<br /> 2. To the extent possible, all common areas where employees or customers are likely to congregate and interact shall be closed or strict social distancing protocols should be enforced (maintaining a minimum of 6 feet distance between individuals and no gatherings of more than 10 people). </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Wash hands often with soap and water or use hand sanitizer<br /> 2. Avoid touching your face </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> All employees shall be provided training regarding minimizing the spread of COVID-19, including reinforcement of proper sanitation, hand-washing, cough and sneeze etiquette, and proper use of PPE. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Prevent the spread of COVID-19 by sending sick employees home.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong></strong><br> Healthcare professionals and facilities may resume performing elective medical and dental procedures and surgeries as allowed and approved by MSDH. Such non-emergent procedures and surgeries should limit their use of disposable PPE and not request PPE from any public source. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://mdes.ms.gov/unemployment-claims/covid19/"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-16 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://us11.campaign-archive.com/?u=08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea&id=4bb1aa945c"> Safe Return </a><a target="_blank" href="https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/f0aaec97-bda1-4120-9b8d-c7f77f2dbd0c/Executive_Order_1492_Safe_Return.pdf"> Executive Order No. 1492 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Missouri')" data-value="28" class="collapsible">Missouri</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.sos.mo.gov/library/reference/orders/2020/eo12" target="_blank"> Executive Order 20-12 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://governor.mo.gov/press-releases/archive/governor-parson-announces-first-phase-show-me-strong-recovery-plan-begin-may" target="_blank"> Show Me Strong Recovery </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Food and drink Restaurant dining (no more than ten (10) people at a single table, are properly adhered to. The continued use of drive-thru, pickup, or delivery options is encouraged)<br /> 2. Personal care Salons, barbershops, tattoo parlors, etc. (Follow general preventative guidelines in addition to any guidance provided by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). <br /> 3. Retail stores (For smaller locations (less than 10,000 square feet), they must maintain 25 percent or less of the authorized occupancy; For larger locations (10,000 square feet or greater), they must maintain 10 percent or less of the authorized occupancy.)<br /> 4. Outdoor and recreation Gyms; Campgrounds (limited number of participants, modified activities, restructured programs, and increased sanitization measures for facilities and participants.)<br /> 5. Entertainment Movie theaters, music venues, etc. (Maintain social distancing guidelines) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Governor Mike Parson announced today that Missouri will fully reopen and enter Phase 2 of its Show Me Strong Recovery Plan on Tuesday, June 16, 2020. <br /> <br /> To protect businesses, communities, and citizens, It is recommended to implement basic infection prevention measures informed by industry best practices, regarding:<br /> Protective equipment;<br /> Temperature checks;<br /> Testing, isolating, and contact tracing; and<br /> Sanitation, including disinfection of common and high-traffic areas (entrances, breakrooms, locations where there is high-frequency employee interaction with the public/customers).<br /> <br /> Businesses are recommended to develop an infectious disease preparedness and response plan, including policies and procedures for workforce contact tracing when an employee tests positive for COVID-19.<br /> <br /> The following are minimum guidelines that apply to all workplaces. Some workplaces, dependent on industry and risk level, may have stricter regulations. Please visit the links for more information, https://showmestrong.mo.gov/businesses/ and https://showmestrong.mo.gov/faq/. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> The Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services has compiled a list of local testing resources for employers, which can be found here https://showmestrong.mo.gov/testing-resources/. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Develop an infectious disease preparedness and response plan, including policies and procedures for workforce contact tracing when an employee tests positive for COVID-19.<br /> <br /> Prepare to implement basic infection prevention measures informed by industry best practices, regarding:<br /> 1. Temperature checks;<br /> 2. Monitor workforce for indicative symptoms. <br /> 3. Do not allow symptomatic people to physically return to work until cleared by a medical provider. NOTE: Some Missouri localities have provisions concerning employee temperature screenings. Please check with your Littler attorney for additional information about your particular jurisdiction. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Prepare to implement basic infection prevention measures informed by industry best practices. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Develop, implement, and communicate about workplace flexibilities and protections, including:<br /> <br /> 1. Encouraging telework whenever possible and feasible with business operations;<br /> 2. Returning to work in phases and/or split shifts, if possible;<br /> 3. Limiting access to common areas where personnel are likely to congregate and interact; and<br /> 4. Ensuring that sick leave policies are flexible and consistent with public health guidance.<br /> 5. Social distancing requirements shall apply in all situations, including, but not limited to, when customers are standing in line or individuals are using shared indoor or outdoor spaces. The social distancing requirements do not apply to individuals performing job duties that require contact with other people closer than 6 feet.<br /> 6. Businesses and citizens are encouraged to continue utilizing delivery services, such as grocery pick-up and/or delivery options, to minimize interaction between people.<br /> 7. Workplaces that are engaged in retail sales to the public must limit the number of customers in each retail location to the following standards based on the workplace's fire or building code occupancy:<br /> 7a. For smaller locations (less than 10,000 square feet), they must maintain 25% or less of the authorized occupancy;<br /> 7b. For larger locations (10,000 square feet or greater), they must maintain 10% or less of the authorized occupancy. Employees at the workplace and vendors delivering products into the store are not included in this calculation and do not count toward occupancy limitations.<br /> <br /> These restrictions do not apply to restaurants or hotels. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Prepare to implement basic infection prevention measures informed by industry best practices, regarding: Sanitation, including disinfection of common and high-traffic areas (entrances, breakrooms, locations where there is high-frequency employee interaction with the public/customers). </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Develop an infectious disease preparedness and response plan, including policies and procedures for workforce contact tracing when an employee tests positive for COVID-19. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> There will still be strict guidelines to ensure safety like health screenings of workers and patients. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://labor.mo.gov/coronavirus"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-16 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://showmestrong.mo.gov/businesses/"> Show Me Strong: Businesses </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www.sos.mo.gov/library/reference/orders/2020/eo12"> Executive Order 20-12 </a><a target="_blank" href="https://governor.mo.gov/show-me-strong-recovery-plan-guidance-and-frequently-asked-questions"> Recovery Plan FAQs </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Montana')" data-value="29" class="collapsible">Montana</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350" target="_blank"> Phase Two Directive for Executive Orders 2-2020 and 3-2020 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://ewscripps.brightspotcdn.com/6e/1c/5691d432448190bac9d8cfd4a81f/reopening-montana-phased-approach.pdf" target="_blank"> Reopening the Big Sky, Phased Approach </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Houses of worship<br /> 2. Retail stores<br /> 3. Personal care (Salons, barbershops, massage parlors)<br /> 4. Food and drink (Restaurant dining, bars, breweries and distilleries - 75% capacity) <br /> 5. Outdoor and recreation (Gyms - 75% capacity and only if they can adhere to strict physical distancing and they exercise frequent sanitation protocols. )<br /> 6. Entertainment (Museums, movie theaters)<br /> 7. Entertainment (Concert venues; Bowling alleys)<br /> 8. Concert halls, bowling alleys, and other places of assembly may operate with reduced capacity and must adhere to strict physical distancing guidelines set forth for group gatherings and follow CDC sanitation protocols.<br /> 9. Child-care facilities (can increase capacity consistent with the guidelines and FAQ contained in the April 1 Directive on childcare and if physical distancing guidelines can be implemented, however the 24-person cap per facility no longer applies)<br /> 10. Senior living or assisted living facilities must continue to follow the guidelines of Phase One.<br /> 11. Outdoor recreation remains in the same operational status as Phase One. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Gov. Steve Bullock has announced the state will move to Phase Two of the Reopening the Big Sky plan beginning June 1 as Montana continues to have the lowest number of positive COVID-19 cases and hospitalizations per capita.<br /> <br /> All businesses may operate, provided they adhere to physical distancing. Businesses should follow CDC sanitation protocols.<br /> <br /> Develop and implement appropriate policies, in accordance with Federal, State, and local regulations and guidance, and informed by industry best practices, regarding:<br /> Social distancing and protective equipment. <br /> Temperature checks and/or symptom screening. <br /> Collaborate with public health on testing, isolating, and contact tracing. <br /> Sanitation. <br /> Use and disinfection of common and high-traffic areas.<br /> <br /> The following are minimum guidelines that apply to all workplaces. Some workplaces, dependent on industry and risk level, may have stricter regulations. Please visit the links for more information, https://ewscripps.brightspotcdn.com/6e/1c/5691d432448190bac9d8cfd4a81f/reopening-montana-phased-approach.pdf and https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Collaborate with public health when implementing policies and procedures for workforce contact tracing following an employee COVID+ test. 2. Encourage voluntary participation of employees in any surveillance testing designed to provide community-wide early warning by local public health officials. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Health assessments must be conducted for all employees at the beginning of each shift. <br /> 2. Monitor workforce for indicative symptoms. <br /> 3. Do not allow people with symptoms of COVID-19 to work. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required </strong><br> Industry standards (OSHA) social distancing and protective equipment. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required </strong><br> 1. Encourage telework whenever possible. <br /> 2. Close common areas where personnel are likely to congregate and interact. <br /> 3. Minimize non-essential business travel. <br /> 4. Avoid gathering in groups of more than 50 people in circumstances that do not readily allow for appropriate physical distancing. <br /> 5. Physical distancing of 6 feet must be maintained between non-congregate customers, this may require:<br /> A reduction in capacity;<br /> A reduction of seating in service and waiting areas;<br /> Management of waiting areas and waiting lines; or<br /> Systems that reduce the amount of contact time between customers and staff. For more industry-specific guidance regarding social distancing, please visit this link https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required </strong><br> 1. Employees must be trained in proper sanitation practices.<br /> 2. Wash your hands with soap and water or use hand sanitizer, especially after touching frequently used items or surfaces<br /> 3. Avoid touching your face<br /> 4. Sneeze or cough into a tissue, or the inside of your elbow<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required </strong><br> 1. A specific cleaning plan must be implemented.<br /> 2. Sanitation<br /> 3. Use and disinfection of common and high-traffic areas<br /> 4. Disinfect frequently used items and surfaces as much as possible<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required </strong><br> Collaborate with public health officials when implementing policies and procedures for workforce contact tracing following an employee's COVID-19 positive test result. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Hospitals resume elective procedures. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Some schools reopened </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.montana.edu/health/coronavirus/employees/ffcra.html"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-16 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350"> Phase 2 Directives </a><a target="_blank" href="https://ewscripps.brightspotcdn.com/6e/1c/5691d432448190bac9d8cfd4a81f/reopening-montana-phased-approach.pdf"> Phased Approach to Reopening Big Sky </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Nebraska')" data-value="30" class="collapsible">Nebraska</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> No stay at home order </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/DHM-SHHD-003.pdf" target="_blank"> Directed Health Measures Order 2020-SSHD-003 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.dropbox.com/s/ykyo4hb6jrmuh4s/Outline%20of%20Changes%20to%20Upcoming%20DHMs_Phase%203.pdf?dl=0" target="_blank"> Phase 3 of Directed Health Measures (Updates to Phase 2) </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Houses of worship (Faith leaders are responsible for the safety of those who attend services in houses of worship and must limit physical participation on the premises depending on the size and structure of the house of worship)<br /> 2. Personal care (Salons, barbershops, tattoo parlors, etc. in certain areas)<br /> 3. Food and drink (Restaurant dining in certain areas - Limit of 50% of maximum occupancy) <br /> 4. Childcare facilities (permitted to have up to 15 kids per room/space)<br /> <br /> Massage Therapy & Body Art - maximum 10-person rule for customers or other invitees, excluding staff<br /> <br /> Reopening soon:<br /> 1. Food and drink (Bars in certain counties)<br /> 2. Entertainment (Zoos in certain counties; Movie theaters in certain counties)<br /> 3. Outdoor and recreation (Pools in certain counties) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> The new directed health measures (DHMs), easing restrictions on businesses and activities, will take effect June 22, 2020. Most counties in Nebraska (89 out of 93) will move to Phase 3 of the reopening on June 22nd. Dakota, Hall, Hamilton, and Merrick counties will move to Phase 2.<br /> <br /> All businesses are hereby reminded to follow any COVID-19 related safety guidelines established or published by their respective professional, regulatory or advisory associations or agencies relating to or regarding the use of PPE. <br /> <br /> The following are minimum guidelines that apply to all workplaces and counties. Some workplaces and counties, dependent on industry and risk level, may have stricter regulations. Please visit the links for more information on county-specific restrictions regarding counties still in Phase 2 (http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/COVID-19-Outline-of-Changes-to-Upcoming-DHMs-Phase-II.pdf), and counties moving to Phase 3 (https://www.dropbox.com/s/ykyo4hb6jrmuh4s/Outline%20of%20Changes%20to%20Upcoming%20DHMs_Phase%203.pdf?dl=0). <br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific</strong><br> 1. Self-monitor twice daily for fever and other symptoms for fourteen days. Coordinate with your health care provider and local public health department. <br /> 2. Individuals who have had Close Contact (see attached Quarantine and Isolation Directions definitions) shall home-Quarantine, unless Quarantined in a health care facility, for a period of no less than fourteen (14) days from the date of their last exposure to a person who tested positive or exhibited or exhibits the above symptoms per attached Quarantine and Isolation Directions. <br /> 3. Definitions and industry-specific guidance can be found here: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/DHM-SHHD-003.pdf </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific</strong><br> 1. Certain businesses require the use of masks. <br /> 2. Guidance for industry-specific best practices can be found here: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Pages/COVID-19-Nebraska-Guidance-Documents.aspx. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific</strong><br> 1. Whenever possible, practice social distancing. <br /> 2. Industry-specific social distancing guidelines can be found here (phase is dependent on county): http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/COVID-19-Outline-of-Changes-to-Upcoming-DHMs-Phase-II.pdf and https://www.dropbox.com/s/ykyo4hb6jrmuh4s/Outline%20of%20Changes%20to%20Upcoming%20DHMs_Phase%203.pdf?dl=0. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Wear a face mask if you are sick.<br /> If you are sick: You should wear a facemask when you are around other people. <br /> 2. Cover your coughs and sneezes <br /> 3. Clean your hands often.<br /> 4. Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Soap and water are the best option, especially if hands are visibly dirty. <br /> Avoid touching: Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands. <br /> <br /> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Wear disposable gloves when cleaning and disinfecting surfaces. Gloves should be discarded after each cleaning. If reusable gloves are used, those gloves should be dedicated for cleaning and disinfection of surfaces for COVID-19 and should not be used for other purposes. <br /> 2. Clean all "high-touch" surfaces everyday. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific</strong><br> 1. Individuals who test positive for COVID-19 or who have the following symptoms-fever of 100.4 F. or above, or a sudden onset of a cough or sudden onset of shortness of breath-shall home-Isolate, unless Isolated in a health care facility, for a period of no less than ten (10) days from the date of the first positive test or onset of symptoms per attached Quarantine and Isolation Directions. <br /> 2. Individuals who have had Close Contact (see attached Quarantine and Isolation Directions definitions) shall home-Quarantine, unless Quarantined in a health care facility, for a period of no less than fourteen (14) days from the date of their last exposure to a person who tested positive or exhibited or exhibits the above symptoms per attached Quarantine and Isolation Directions. <br /> 3. Quarantine and Isolation Directions can be found here: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/DHM-SHHD-003.pdf. Industry-specific guidance on how to address confirmed cases can be found here: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Pages/COVID-19-Nebraska-Guidance-Documents.aspx. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Reopen May 4th under certain guidelines Hospitals can resume elective surgeries if they maintain 30% general bed availability, 30% ICU bed availability, 30% ventilator availability, AND have a two-week supply of necessary personal protective equipment (PPE) in their specific facility. <br /> Procedural guidelines for resuming elective procedures will be at the discretion of the hospital or health clinic. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed, could be reopening come fall </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://dol.nebraska.gov/PressRelease/Details/141"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-16 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="http://dhhs.ne.gov/Pages/COVID-19-Nebraska-Guidance-Documents.aspx"> Nebraska Guidance Documents </a><a target="_blank" href="http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/DHM-SHHD-003.pdf"> Directed Health Measure Order </a><a target="_blank" href="http://dhhs.ne.gov/Pages/COVID-19-Directed-Health-Measures.aspx"> Understanding Directed Health Measures </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Nevada')" data-value="31" class="collapsible">Nevada</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="http://gov.nv.gov/News/Emergency_Orders/2020/2020-05-28_-_COVID-19_Declaration_of_Emergency_Directive_021_-_Phase_Two_Reopening_Plan_(Attachments)/" target="_blank"> Phase Two Reopening Plan </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://nvhealthresponse.nv.gov/nevada-united/" target="_blank"> Nevada United Roadmap to Recovery </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now (Phase 2 - will last 2-3 weeks):<br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation (Golf courses, pickleball, tennis courts; State parks)<br /> 2. Retail (Retail stores) <br /> 3. Food and drink (Restaurants, Bars (that do not serve food) - 50% maximum capacity and strict social distancing) <br /> 4. Personal care Barber Shops, hair salons and nail salons<br /> 5. Gyms, fitness facilities and other studios (Larger gyms are capped at 50% of occupancy per fire code and must also adhere to the strict social. distancing requirements) (If a smaller gym or studio can only accommodate 10 or less people, they may only do so if they can adhere to the social distancing requirements and keep 6 feet of distance between all individuals.)<br /> 6. Personal care (Cosmetology and skin services; Massage therapy; Tattoo and piercing shops)<br /> 7. Entertainment (Museums, art galleries, zoos and aquariums; Movie theaters, bowling alleys; Outdoor attractions - no more than 50 percent of capacity and must maintain at least 6 ft of social distancing)<br /> 8. Retail (Malls - 50% capacity mandate and social distancing requirements) <br /> 9. Houses of worship (maximum of 50 people attending a service at a time and strict social distancing of at least 6 ft)<br /> <br /> Remain Closed during Phase 2:<br /> 1. Adult entertainment establishments<br /> 2. Nightclubs and day clubs <br /> 3. Live sporting event venues and live performance venues WITH spectators.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> All essential and non-essential businesses opening or continuing operations in Phase 2 must adopt measures promulgated by the Nevada State Occupational Safety and Health Administration (NV OSHA) to minimize the risk of spread of COVID-19, including social distancing and sanitation measures, and abide by all other guidance promulgated pursuant to the Phase 2 directive.<br /> <br /> All businesses should consider proactive measures to help protect staff and customers, including but not limited to: <br /> Implementing separate operating hours for the elderly and vulnerable customers<br /> Designating with signage, tape or by other means, six feet of spacing for employees, customers, clients, or members to maintain appropriate distance. <br /> Having hand sanitizer, and other sanitizing products, readily available for employees and customers.<br /> <br /> Business owners and employees are strongly encouraged to review the industry-specific guidance and recommendations referenced above as the guidelines and protocols outlined in this document are general and summary in nature. The entirety of the Phase 2 requirements and best practices can be found in the industry-specific guidance and the Phase 2 Directive, both linked here: https://nvhealthresponse.nv.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Phase-Two-Reopening-General-Guidance.pdf and http://gov.nv.gov/News/Emergency_Orders/2020/2020-05-28_-_COVID-19_Declaration_of_Emergency_Directive_021_-_Phase_Two_Reopening_Plan_(Attachments)/.<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Consider encouraging employees to do a self-assessment each day in order to check if they have any COVID-19 type symptoms (fever, cough or shortness of breath).<br /> 2. Remind employees to stay home when sick, use cough and sneeze etiquette, and practice hand hygiene.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. All employers shall require employees who interact with the public to wear face coverings, to the maximum extent practicable.<br /> 2. Businesses should strongly encourage guests, customers, or clients to wear face coverings.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Continue to encourage telework, whenever possible and feasible with business operations<br /> 2. Close common areas where personnel are likely to congregate and interact or enforce strict social distancing protocols<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Businesses should consider having hand sanitizer, and other sanitizing products, readily available for employees and customers.<br /> 2. Use cough and sneeze etiquette, and practice hand hygiene<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> Frequently perform enhanced environmental cleaning of commonly touched surfaces. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Immediately isolate and seek medical care for any individual who develops symptoms while at work and follow CDC guidelines.<br /> 2. Remind employees to stay home when sick.<br /> 3. Follow guidance from the Nevada Labor Commissioner regarding sick leave policies.<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Starting the week of 05/04, the Nevada Hospital Association is allowing Nevada hospitals to perform elective surgeries again. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.littler.com/files/nevada_leave_guidance_-_covid-19.pdf"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> California, Washington, Nevada and Oregon will form a joint task force to plan for reopening </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-16 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://nvhealthresponse.nv.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Phase-Two-Reopening-General-Guidance.pdf"> Phase 2 and Industry Specific Guidance </a><a target="_blank" href="http://gov.nv.gov/News/Emergency_Orders/2020/2020-05-28_-_COVID-19_Declaration_of_Emergency_Directive_021_-_Phase_Two_Reopening_Plan_(Attachments)/"> Emergency Directive 021 </a><a target="_blank" href="https://nvhealthresponse.nv.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Industry-specific-Guidance-Documents-1.pdf"> Industry Specifc Guidance </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on New Hampshire')" data-value="32" class="collapsible">New Hampshire</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.governor.nh.gov/sites/g/files/ehbemt336/files/documents/2020-10.pdf" target="_blank"> Executive Order 2020-10 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.covidguidance.nh.gov/sites/g/files/ehbemt381/files/files/inline-documents/guidance-universal.pdf" target="_blank"> Safer At Home Universal Guidelines </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Retail (Retail stores - 50 percent or less of store occupancy)<br /> 2. Personal care (Barbershops, hair salons, etc. - A maximum of no more than 10 total people at any one time (staff and clients combined), plus the number of clients should not exceed the number of staff)<br /> 3. Outdoor and recreation (Golf courses; Outdoor attractions)<br /> 4. Food and drink Restaurants open for outdoor dining<br /> 5. Health and Fitness (limited to at most 50% of the maximum licensed capacity) <br /> 6. Outdoor and recreation (Beaches; Personal and small group fitness training - SEACOAST BEACH (THE SAND) PLAN: All seacoast beaches will be open for only transitory physical activity,<br /> including but not limited to walking, running, swimming, surfing, kayaking and paddle boarding. Group size limited to 10 individuals or less. PARKING - limited to 50% capacity)<br /> 7. Personal care (Nail salons; Tanning salons; Tattoo shops; Acupuncturists and massage therapists - A maximum of no more than seven (7) operating stations per 1000 square feet is allowed at the facility at any time)<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Businesses and their employees should follow guidance issued by the CDC, as well as any applicable federal or state regulatory requirements to reduce transmission among employees and customers; maintain healthy business operations; and maintain a healthy work environment. In addition to these general guidelines for all Granite State employers and employees, each business should refer to and follow their industry-specific guidelines, as those guidelines are set forth.<br /> <br /> Plan for potential COVID-19 cases: Implement plans to continue your essential business functions in case you experience higher than usual absenteeism. Employers should work with state and local officials when needed to monitor and investigate cases of COVID-19. In all cases, employers must work in a manner to ensure privacy rights.<br /> <br /> Communicate frequently with both employees and customers about steps being taken to prevent spread of COVID-19 in the workplace: Employers should communicate expectations to employees with recommendations on steps everybody can take steps to prevent spread of COVID-19. Post extensive signage on health policies, including the following documents in the workplace to help educate building occupants on COVID-19 best practices. Communicate with customers about steps being taken to protect them from COVID-19 exposure in the workplace. <br /> <br /> The following are minimum guidelines that apply to all workplaces. Some workplaces, dependent on industry and risk level, may have stricter regulations. Please visit the links for more information, https://businesshelp.nheconomy.com/hc/en-us/articles/360050442453-What-s-Open-Guidelines. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Employees who have symptoms should notify their supervisor and stay home.<br /> 2. Employers must develop a process for screening all employees reporting for work for COVID-19 related symptoms as follows: <br /> a. Identify a location and assign a person who will screen each employee every day before they enter the work-place. Such plans should be clearly communicated with employees. The person performing the screening should wear a cloth face covering/mask. All employees (see guidance below) should also wear a cloth face covering while at work and in potential close contact with others. <br /> b. The screener should ask the following questions: i. Have you been in close contact with a confirmed case of COVID-19? 1. NOTE: Healthcare workers caring for COVID-19 patients while wearing appropriate personal protective equipment should answer no to this question ii. Have you had a fever or felt feverish in the last 72 hours? iii. Are you experiencing any respiratory symptoms including a runny nose, sore throat, cough, or shortness of breath? iv. Are you experiencing any new muscle aches or chills? v. Have you experienced any new change in your sense of taste or smell? <br /> c. Document the temperature of all employees daily before their shift: i. Employers should take the temperatures of their employees on-site with a non-touch thermometer each day upon the employees arrival at work. ii. If this is not possible, temperatures can be taken before arriving as long as it can sufficiently be authenticated by the employee. Normal temperature should not exceed 100.0 degrees Fahrenheit.<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. While at work and in public, employees should wear a cloth face covering to help protect against the spread of the virus.<br /> 2. Employers must reduce the risk to employees in the workplace by supporting the use of cloth face coverings in areas where social distancing is difficult to maintain.<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. To the greatest extent possible, all employees should maintain safe social distancing, which means keeping a distance of at least 6 or more feet between one another at all times.<br /> 2. Employers must reduce the risk to employees in the workplace by implementing social distancing guidelines, and modifying employee schedules, where possible, to reduce the number of physical interactions. Meetings, for example, should be conducted by phone or computer conferencing applications when able; in-person meetings should be limited and employees should maintain a safe distance of at least 6 feet from others at all times. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Employers must strongly promote frequent hand hygiene and alcohol-based hand sanitizer must be made readily available as follows: a. Monitor employee hand washing or use of hand sanitizer and encourage frequent hand hygiene. If possible, employers should make available individual bottles of hand sanitizer to each employee and place hand sanitizer in frequently visited locations for both employees and customers. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Implement workplace cleaning and disinfection practices: These practices should follow CDC guidelines with regular sanitation of high-moderate touch surfaces at least every two hours. Employers must develop policies for worker protection and provide training to all staff prior to assigning cleaning tasks.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. When exposed to COVID-19 or if diagnosed with COVID-19, employees must stay home.<br /> 2. Employers must handle employee(s) who exhibit COVID-19 symptoms (e.g. Answers yes to any of the screening questions or who is found to have a fever) as follows: <br /> a. Instruct the employee to leave the premises immediately and to seek medical advice . Per EEOC and other pertinent guidelines, employers must maintain the confidentiality of employee health information. b. Prevent stigma and discrimination in the workplace. Do not make determinations of health risk or health status based on race or country of origin.<br /> 3. If an employee becomes sick during the day, they should be sent home immediately. Surfaces in their workspace should be cleaned and disinfected.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Partially Opened</strong><br> Reopened for a limited range of elective and other time-sensitive procedures </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Plan to reopen in Fall </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.nhrs.org/faqs/faq---covid-19-guidance-for-participating-employers"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-17 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.covidguidance.nh.gov/sites/g/files/ehbemt381/files/files/inline-documents/guidance-universal.pdf"> universal guidelines </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www.covidguidance.nh.gov/"> COVID Guidance </a><a target="_blank" href="https://businesshelp.nheconomy.com/hc/en-us/articles/360050442453-What-s-Open-Guidelines"> What's Open Guidelines </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on New Jersey')" data-value="33" class="collapsible">New Jersey</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://nj.gov/infobank/eo/056murphy/pdf/EO-147.pdf" target="_blank"> Executive Order 147 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="http://d31hzlhk6di2h5.cloudfront.net/20200427/db/2d/77/6c/2a8a498ff2edda855c3f456d/The_Road_Back_-_Restoring_Economic_Health_Through_Public_Health.pdf" target="_blank"> The Road Back: Restoring Economic Health Through Public Health. </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation (Golf courses; Outdoor recreational businesses; Beaches)<br /> 2. Industries Construction<br /> 3. Retail (open to curbside pickup)<br /> 4. Youth Summer programs<br /> 5. Limited fitness/gyms<br /> 6. Museums/libraries<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> All residents and businesses should follow state and federal safeguarding guidelines:<br /> Wash hands<br /> Wear masks in public<br /> Respect social distancing<br /> Minimize gatherings<br /> Disinfect workplace and businesses<br /> Minimize gatherings <br /> No mass gatherings <br /> Place conspicuous signage at entrances and throughout the store, if applicable, alerting staff and customers to the required six feet of physical distance.<br /> <br /> The following are minimum cleaning guidelines that apply to all essential retail businesses, as explained in Executive Order 122, found here: http://d31hzlhk6di2h5.cloudfront.net/20200408/c8/1b/61/37/b3f185e69487ad0f80d760b1/EO-122.pdf. Some workplaces, dependent on industry and risk level, may have stricter regulations. Please visit the link for more information, https://faq.business.nj.gov/en/articles/3820777-which-businesses-may-be-open-and-what-guidelines-must-be-followed<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Personnel undergo temperature monitoring and symptom checks upon arrival to work and at least every 12 hours while at work, and self-monitor (take temperature, assess for symptoms) twice a day when at home. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Require workers and customers to wear cloth face coverings while on the premises, except where doing so would inhibit that individuals health or where the individual is under two years of age, and require workers to wear gloves when in contact with customers or goods. <br /> 2. Businesses must provide, at their expense, such face coverings and gloves for their employees.<br /> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Demarcate 6 feet of spacing in check-out lines to demonstrate appropriate social distancing<br /> 2. Place conspicuous signage at entrances and throughout the store alerting staff and customers to the required 6 feet of distance<br /> 3. Limit all worksite meetings and groups to fewer than 10 people </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Require infection control practices, such as regular hand washing, coughing and sneezing etiquette, and proper tissue usage and disposal<br /> 2. Provide sanitization materials, such as hand sanitizer and sanitizing wipes, to staff and customers<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Require frequent sanitization of high-touch areas like restrooms, credit card machines, keypads, counters and shopping carts<br /> 2. Clean and disinfect the worksite in accordance with CDC guidelines when a worker at the site has been diagnosed with COVID-19 illness<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Immediately separate and send home workers who appear to have symptoms consistent with COVID-19 illness upon arrival at work or who become sick during the day.<br /> 2. Promptly notify workers of any known exposure to COVID-19 at the worksite, consistent with the confidentiality requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act and any other applicable laws.<br /> 3. Clean and disinfect the worksite in accordance with CDC guidelines when a worker at the site has been diagnosed with COVID-19 illness<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Elective Surgeries and Invasive Procedures to Resume </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Possibly Reopening Soon </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.nj.gov/labor/worker-protections/earnedsick/law.shtml"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Massachusetts and Delaware will form a joint task force to plan for reopening the economy </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-17 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="http://d31hzlhk6di2h5.cloudfront.net/20200408/c8/1b/61/37/b3f185e69487ad0f80d760b1/EO-122.pdf"> Executive Order 122 </a><a target="_blank" href="https://faq.business.nj.gov/en/articles/3820777-does-my-business-need-to-be-closed"> Does my business need to close? </a><a target="_blank" href="https://nj.gov/infobank/eo/056murphy/pdf/EO-147.pdf"> Executive Order 147 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on New Mexico')" data-value="34" class="collapsible">New Mexico</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://cv.nmhealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GovernorsOffice@state.nm_.us_20200612_082914.pdf" target="_blank"> Public Health Order 6/12/2020 </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://indd.adobe.com/view/3f732e94-0164-424d-9ac6-a0ace27e70c8" target="_blank"> All Together New Mexico </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation (State parks; Golf courses, boating)<br /> 2. Personal care (Pet grooming and boarding, veterinary services)<br /> 3. Retail stores (25% capacity)<br /> 4. Industries Offices at (25% apacity)<br /> 5. Houses of worship (25% capacity) <br /> 6. Food and drink Restaurant dining (offer indoor dine-in service at 50% of maximum occupancy)<br /> 7. Outdoor and recreation Gyms, pools (Gyms will also be able to open half-full, Pools can reopen for lap swimming and lessons with up to two students, and personal training will be allowed at gyms for up to two trainees)<br /> 3. Personal care (Hair salons, barbershops, tattoo parlors, massage parlors, nail salons - 25% occupancy)<br /> 4. Retail (Malls - 25% occupancy, although with food courts closed and loitering prohibited)<br /> 5. Drive-in theaters will be allowed to open, and hotels can operate at 50% of occupancy.<br /> 6. Offices and call centers (25% capacity) <br /> 7. Hotels may (50%of maximum occupancy)<br /> <br /> Remain Closed:<br /> 1. Theaters<br /> 2. Casinos<br /> 3. Zoos<br /> 4. Bowling alleys<br /> 5. Museums<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Best practice is to develop a COVID-19 communication plan and provide a forum for answering employee questions and addressing concerns, and to appoint a COVID-Safe Practice leader or team to enact safe practices in the workplace. <br /> <br /> Train all employees on daily cleaning and disinfecting protocol, hygiene, and respiratory etiquette. <br /> <br /> Employers are asked to provide safe working conditions for their employees in the workplace. General guidance includes the following: <br /> 1.Limit operations to remote work to the greatest extent possible. <br /> 2. Arrange workplace to provide for 6-feet of distance between individuals wherever possible. <br /> 3. Close common areas where personnel are likely to congregate wherever possible or modify them to minimize contact. <br /> 4. Provide for all meetings to take place remotely whenever possible. <br /> 5. All employees should be provided with appropriate face coverings and should wear them in the workplace. <br /> 6. Train all employees on daily cleaning and disinfecting protocol, hygiene, and respiratory etiquette (e.g., covering coughs). <br /> 7. Make handwashing, sanitizer, and other hygiene support available to employees. <br /> 8. Screen employees before they enter the workplace each day (verbally or with a written form or app). Send employees home who are experiencing the following COVID-19. symptoms related to COVID-19 and direct them to obtain free testing through the New Mexico Department of Health. - Fever, cough, shortness of breath, chills, repeated shaking with chills, muscle pain, headache, sore throat and/or loss of taste or smell. <br /> 9. Prohibit employees with known close contact to a person who is lab-confirmed to have COVID-19 to return to work until the end of the 14-day self-isolation period <br /> 10. Minimize non-essential travel. Adhere to CDC guidelines and state orders regarding isolation following out-of-state travel. <br /> 11. Adhere to all CDC and OSHA guidelines.<br /> <br /> The following are minimum guidelines that apply to all businesses. Some workplaces, dependent on industry and risk level, may have stricter regulations. Please visit the link for more information, https://indd.adobe.com/view/3f732e94-0164-424d-9ac6-a0ace27e70c8. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required </strong><br> Direct employees who experience COVID-19 symptoms to obtain free testing through the Department of Health, linked here https://cv.nmhealth.org/. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Screen employees before they enter the workplace each day (verbally or with a written form or text-based or other app). <br /> 2. Send employees home who are experiencing the following COVID-19 symptoms:<br /> Fever<br /> Cough<br /> Sore throat<br /> Headache <br /> Muscle pain<br /> Shortness of breath<br /> Chills<br /> Repeated shaking with chills<br /> Loss of taste or smell <br /> 3. Prohibit employees with known close contact to a person who is lab-confirmed to have COVID-19 to return to work until authorized by the Department of Health. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Ensure all employees have face coverings or masks and wear them in the workplace at all times when in the presence of others, except when eating, drinking, or exercising or unless otherwise advised by a health care provider. 2 All employees should be provided with appropriate face coverings and should wear them in<br /> the workplace.<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Arrange the workplace to provide 6 feet of distance between individuals whenever possible. <br /> 2. Minimize non-essential travel. <br /> 3. Adhere to maximum occupancy and staffing limits per the States Public Health Order. <br /> 4. Close common areas where personnel are likely to congregate wherever possible or modify them to minimize contact. <br /> 5. Provide for all meetings to take place remotely whenever possible. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Make handwashing, sanitizer, and other hygiene support available to employees. <br /> 2. Train all employees on daily cleaning and disinfecting protocol, hygiene, and respiratory etiquette.<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Maintain a schedule of stringent daily cleaning and sanitizing. Clean and sanitize shared workstations between shifts.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Prohibit employees with known close contact to a person who is lab-confirmed to have COVID-19 to return to work until authorized by the Department of Health. <br /> 2. To support contact tracing, best practice is to offer all customers who visit the establishment with the opportunity to record their name and phone number or email address, along with the date and time of their visit, and retain such records for no less than four weeks from the date of collection. <br /> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Elective Surgeries Resume </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Plan to reopen in Fall </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.dws.state.nm.us/COVID-19-Info"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-17 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://cv.nmhealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GovernorsOffice@state.nm_.us_20200612_082914.pdf"> Public Health Order 6/12/2020 </a><a target="_blank" href="https://d3el53au0d7w62.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/04/Guidance_Return_to_Work_COVID-19_.pdf"> Back to Work Guidance </a><a target="_blank" href="https://indd.adobe.com/view/3f732e94-0164-424d-9ac6-a0ace27e70c8"> All Together New Mexico </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on New York')" data-value="35" class="collapsible">New York</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Regional reopening in progress; As of June 17, NYC </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.governor.ny.gov/news/no-20241-continuing-temporary-suspension-and-modification-laws-relating-disaster-emergency" target="_blank"> Executive Order regarding Phase 3 industries </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.governor.ny.gov/programs/new-york-forward" target="_blank"> New York Forward </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Phase 1:<br /> 1. Construction<br /> 2. Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting<br /> 3. Retail - (Limited to curbside or in-store pickup or drop off)<br /> 4. Manufacturing<br /> 5. Wholesale Trade<br /> 6. 3. Malls (any stores without their own external entrance(s) may operate via curbside pickup in Phase 1 and 2 providing purchased items to customers at or near the general mall entrance and any stores with their own external entrance(s) separate from the general mall entrance (e.g. strip malls, anchor tenants), may open for curbside and in-store pickup in Phase 1 and all in-store retail activities in Phase 2)<br /> <br /> Phase 2:<br /> 1. Hair salons and barbershops<br /> 2. Houses of worship (25% capacity) <br /> 3. Malls (any stores without their own external entrance(s) may operate via curbside pickup in Phase 1 and 2 providing purchased items to customers at or near the general mall entrance and any stores with their own external entrance(s) separate from the general mall entrance (e.g. strip malls, anchor tenants), may open for curbside and in-store pickup in Phase 1 and all in-store retail activities in Phase 2)<br /> 4. Gyms, fitness centers, and exercise classes<br /> 5. Video lottery and casino gaming facilities<br /> 6. Movie theaters (except drive-ins)<br /> 7. Places of public amusement, whether indoors or outdoors, including but not limited to, locations with amusement rides, carnivals, amusement parks, water parks, aquariums, zoos, arcades, fairs, childrens play centers, funplexes, theme parks, bowling alleys, family and childrens attractions<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> These guidelines apply to all business activities where the core function takes place within an office setting that have been permitted to reopen as well as to office-based businesses statewide that were previously permitted to operate as essential. This guidance may apply but is not limited to businesses and entities in the following sectors: Professional services, nonprofit, technology, administrative support, and higher education administration (excluding full campus reopening). Please note that these guidelines may also apply to business operating parts of their business functions under different guidelines (e.g. front office for a construction company). See Interim COVID-19 Guidance for Office-Based Work for full details. <br /> <br /> 1. Affirm you have reviewed and understand the state issued industry guidelines, and that you will implement them. <br /> 2. Post signage inside and outside of the office location to remind personnel and customers to adhere to proper hygiene, social distancing rules, appropriate use of PPE, and cleaning and disinfecting protocols. <br /> 3. Train all personnel on new protocols and frequently communicate safety guidelines. <br /> 4. Provide building managers/owners a list of essential visitors expected to enter the building. If a worker or visitor was in close or proximate contact with others at the office location and tests positive for COVID-19, immediately notify and cooperate with state and local health departments with contact tracing efforts, including notification of potential contacts, such as workers, visitors, and/or customers (if known) who had close or proximate contact with the individual, while maintaining confidentiality required by state and federal law and regulations.<br /> <br /> During the COVID-19 public health emergency, all operators of office workspaces should stay up to date with any changes to state and federal requirements related to office workspaces and incorporate those changes into their operations.
