<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Virginia')" data-value="51" class="collapsible">Virginia</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Phase Reopening </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.governor.virginia.gov/media/governorvirginiagov/governor-of-virginia/pdf/Virginia-Forward-Phase-One-Business-Sector-Guidelines.pdf" target="_blank"> Safer At Home Phase One) </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.governor.virginia.gov/media/governorvirginiagov/governor-of-virginia/pdf/Slide-deck-5.8.2020-Forward-Virginia-Phase-One.pdf" target="_blank"> Forward Virginia </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Restaurants (indoor dining at 50% capacity)<br /> 2. Gyms and fitness centers (indoor areas at 30% capacity)<br /> 3. Swimming pools<br /> 4. Entertainment venues (museums, zoo and botanical gardens - Occupancy must be limited to no more than 50%)<br /> 5. Recreational sports will be allowed with physical distancing requirements and no sharing of sporting equipment.<br /> 6. Religious Services (limited to no more than 50%) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> 1. Establish policies and practices for physical distancing between co-workers and between members of the public.<br /> 2. Provide clear communication and signage for physical distancing in areas where individuals may congregate, especially at entrances, in seating areas, and in check-out lines.<br /> 3. Limit the occupancy of physical spaces to ensure that adequate physical distancing may be maintained.<br /> 4. Encourage telework whenever possible.<br /> 5. For those businesses where telework is not feasible, temporarily move or stagger workstations to ensure six feet of separation between co-workers and between members of the public. <br /> 6. Where possible, employees and customers should utilize face coverings. (See CDC Use of Cloth Face Coverings guidance for more detailed information). Where six feet of physical distance is not possible in a given business setting, employers should provide face covering to employees, such as utilizing the CDC Use of Cloth Face Coverings guidance.<br /> 7. Limit in-person work-related gatherings, including conferences, trade shows, and trainings.<br /> 8. When in-person meetings need to occur, keep meetings as short as possible, limit the number of employees in attendance, and use physical distancing practices. For more information, please visit these links for Phase One and Phase Two business guidelines, https://www.governor.virginia.gov/media/governorvirginiagov/governor-of-virginia/pdf/Virginia-Forward-Phase-One-Business-Sector-Guidelines.pdf and https://www.governor.virginia.gov/media/governorvirginiagov/governor-of-virginia/pdf/Virginia-Forward-Phase-Two-Guidelines.pdf. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. If you tested positive for COVID-19 and never had any symptoms and were directed to care for yourself at home, you can leave your "sick room" and home if: 1a. At least 10 days have passed since the date of your first positive COVID-19 diagnostic test 2b. AND you continue to have no symptoms since the test. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. VDH encourages employers to share the questions below with employees and, regardless of a known exposure, ask them to use these questions as a guide for assessing themselves prior to arrival at work and throughout the workday. <br /> 2. COVID-19 Screening Protocol: Survey for employee self-administration "YES or NO, since your last day of work, or since your last visit to this facility, have you had any of the following:"<br /> 2a. A new fever (100.4F or higher) or a sense of having a fever?<br /> 2b. A new cough that you cannot attribute to another health condition?<br /> 2c. New shortness of breath that you cannot attribute to another health condition?<br /> 2d. New chills that you cannot attribute to another health condition?<br /> 2e. A new sore throat that you cannot attribute to another health condition?<br /> 2f. New muscle aches (myalgia) that you cannot attribute to another health condition, <br /> 3. If an employee or visitor answers YES to any of the screening questions, the employer should activate the emergency protocol for COVID-19. <br /> Designate a staff person to be responsible for responding to COVID-19 concerns. Employees should know who this person is and how to contact them.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Follow CDC recommendation for wearing cloth face coverings. Required face covering in public areas. <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Reconfigure seating areas to allow six feet of physical distance between individuals by eliminating or closing select tables or seating areas, or by spreading them out to allow for adequate spacing. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Provide a place for employees and customers to wash hands with soap and water, or provide alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing at least 60% alcohol.<br /> 2. Individual sectors may have stricter guidelines<br /> 3. Provide best hygiene practices to employees on a regular basis, including washing hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds and practicing respiratory etiquette protocols. A CDC training video is available here: https://www.cdc.gov/handwashing/videos.html.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Practice routine cleaning and disinfection of high contact areas and hard surfaces, including check out stations and payment pads, store entrance push/pull pads, door knobs/handles, dining tables/chairs, light switches, handrails, restrooms, floors, and equipment.<br /> 2. For high contact areas, routinely disinfect surfaces at least every 2 hours<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Designate a coordinator who will be responsible for identifying COVID-19 related issues and their impact on the gathering, including coordinating health preparedness for the event and emergency response planning.<br /> 2. Close off areas used by a sick person and do not use them until after cleaning and disinfection. Wait 24 hours before cleaning and disinfecting. If it is not possible to wait 24 hours, wait as long as possible<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Resume 5/1 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Reopening come Fall </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/coronavirus/guidance-for-increased-absenteeism-sick-leave-policies/"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-18 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.virginia.gov/coronavirus/forwardvirginia/"> Forward Virginia Guidelines </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www.governor.virginia.gov/media/governorvirginiagov/governor-of-virginia/pdf/Slide-deck-5.8.2020-Forward-Virginia-Phase-One.pdf"> Forward Virginia </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Washington')" data-value="52" class="collapsible">Washington</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home expired May 31- reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.governor.wa.gov/sites/default/files/20-25.3%20-%20COVID-19%20Stay%20Home%20Stay%20Healthy%20-%20Reopening%20%28tmp%29.pdf?utm_medium=email&utm_source=govdelivery" target="_blank"> Stay Home - Stay Healthy </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.governor.wa.gov/sites/default/files/SafeStartWA_4May20.pdf" target="_blank"> Safe Start Washington </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Recreation and fitness (Only allowed outdoor with 5 (not including the instructor) or fewer people outside of household<br /> 2. Gatherings (Only allowed outdoor of 5 or fewer people outside the household)<br /> 3. Real estate (25% of building occupancy, Indoor services limited to 30 minutes)<br /> 4. In-store Retail (15% of building occupancy, Indoor services limited to 30 minutes)<br /> 5. Personal Services (25% of building occupancy)<br /> 6. Professional services (25% of building occupancy, Indoor services limited to 30 minutes for customers)<br /> 7. Pet grooming (25% of building occupancy) <br /> 8. Restaurants (No indoor dining allowing, Outdoor dining is permitted but seating at 50% of existing outdoor capacity) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> 1. Employers must ensure social distancing practices for employees and control customer flow; frequent and adequate employee handwashing, facilities and surface sanitation; and ensure sick employees stay home or go home if they feel ill. Employers must also provide basic workplace hazard education<br /> about coronavirus and how to prevent transmission in the language best understood by the employee.<br /> 2. Fact sheets for specific industries such as grocery, agriculture, and construction are available at www.Lni.wa.gov/safety-health/safety-topics/ topics/coronavirus. For more informations, please visit https://www.governor.wa.gov/sites/default/files/BCG%20-%20Planning%20for%20a%20New%20Normal%20%28Summary%20%26%20Checklists%29%2004_27.pdf. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific </strong><br> Ask workers/volunteers to self-certify that they have experienced no CV-19 symptoms since last day of work at, or visit to, the workplace. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Identify personal protective equipment (PPE) and cloth facial coverings in accordance with L&I requirements on facial coverings and industry specific COVID-19 standards. Provide the necessary PPE and supplies to employees.<br /> 2. Provide workers/volunteers with masks for any public-facing job and/or those whose responsibility includes operating within physical distancing limits of 6 ft. for extended periods of time<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Move workstations farther apart. <br /> 2. Reduce the number of workstations in use at a given time. <br /> 3. Move certain tasks or meetings to times and/or locations with fewer people present.<br /> 4. Make provisions to prevent close contact between workers and others (e.g., coworkers and the public) when transferring items, tools, or materials. For example, require one-at-a-time access at designated drop-off/pick-up points. <br /> 5. Control the number of people entering the building or office. <br /> 6. Stagger work schedules so workers don't crowd when they arrive and leave work.<br /> 7. Use dividers or floors markings to distinguish appropriate spacing for people waiting in lines or in front of service counters<br /> 8. Designate one or more employee(s) as a "physical distance monitor" - similar to a safety monitor to ensure social distancing practices are consistently followed. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Provide enough fixed or portable hand washing facilities or stations at workplaces and jobsites so employees can wash their hands frequently with soap and hot and cold (or tepid) running water. <br /> 2. Ensure an adequate supply of soap, water, and towels; set up a schedule for frequent restocking of supplies and emptying of trash<br /> 3. Require workers to wash hands frequently and effectively when they arrive at work, leave their workstations for breaks, use the bathroom; before and after they eat or drink or use tobacco products; and after touching any surfaces suspected of being contaminated.<br /> 4. Provide supplemental hand sanitizer stations, wipes or towelettes, or clean water and soap in portable containers to facilitate more frequent handwashing after handling objects touched by others<br /> 5. Gloves may be provided, but also must be washed regularly to prevent the spread of the virus. This may help for workers whose hands are bothered by frequent washing and sanitizing<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Provide appropriate and adequate cleaning supplies for scheduled and, when necessary, spot cleaning and cleaning after a suspected or confirmed COVID-19 case. <br /> 2. Ensure floors, counters, and other surfaces are regularly cleaned with water and soap, or other cleaning liquids to prevent build-up of dirt and residues that can harbor contamination. <br /> 3. Make sure high-touch surfaces are properly disinfected on a frequent or periodic basis using a bleach solution or other EPA-approved disinfectant (see link to CDC cleaning guidelines below).<br /> 4. Ensure employees follow effective cleaning procedures and use protective gloves and eye/face protection (e.g. face shields and/or goggles) when mixing, spraying, and wiping with liquid cleaning products, like diluted bleach. <br /> 5. Make sure shared work vehicles are regularly cleaned and disinfected. <br /> 6. Keep Safety Data Sheets (SDSs) for all disinfectants on site. <br /> 7. Don't mix chemicals - many are incompatible; and be sure to dilute and use chemicals per manufacturer specifications.<br /> 8. Follow cleaning guidelines set by the CDC. www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/ organizations/cleaning-disinfection.html.<br /> 9. Be sure to wash and rinse visible dirt/debris from equipment, tools, and other items before disinfecting. <br /> 10. Cover fabric and rough surfaces with smooth materials so they are easier to clean.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Employees who show signs of COVID-19 (fever, cough, or trouble breathing): Place them in a private room away from others. Ask them to wear a face mask. Notify your local health department right away. They will tell you what to do<br /> 2. If an employee has COVID-19: Keep it confidential. This is required by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). Inform close contacts of the sick employee that they may have been close to someone with COVID-19. Direct employees to the Department of Health webpage or the Coronavirus assessment tool developed by Microsoft and Providence.<br /> 3. Employees who have a family member at home with COVID-19 should: Notify their employer. Stay home and avoid public places for 14 days. Keep track of their health for fever, cough, and trouble breathing for 14 days after the last day they were in contact with the sick person. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Resume as long as providers comply with health and safety protocols </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Plan to reopen in Fall </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.lni.wa.gov/agency/outreach/paid-sick-leave-and-coronavirus-covid-19-common-questions"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> California, Washington, Nevada and Oregon will form a joint task force to plan for reopening </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-18 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.governor.wa.gov/sites/default/files/SafeStartWA_4May20.pdf"> Phased Reopen Approach </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www.governor.wa.gov/issues/issues/covid-19-resources/covid-19-reopening-guidance-businesses-and-workers"> Reopen Guidance for Businesses </a><a target="_blank" href="https://www.governor.wa.gov/sites/default/files/COVID19Phase2ProfessionalServicesGuidance.pdf"> Professional Services </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on West Virginia')" data-value="53" class="collapsible">West Virginia</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order expired - Reopening in progress </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://governor.wv.gov/Documents/2020%20Executive%20Orders/Executive-Order-April-30-2020-Safer-At-Home-Order.pdf" target="_blank"> Safer at Home Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://governor.wv.gov/Pages/The-Comeback.aspx" target="_blank"> West Virginia Strong - The Comeback </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Personal care Salons, barbershops, pet groomers; Tanning salons<br /> 2. Outdoor and recreation Gyms, recreation centers; State parks, campgrounds; Museums, zoos<br /> 3. Food and drink (Restaurant & Bars - 50% capacity)<br /> 4. Retail <br /> <br /> Reopening soon:<br /> 1. Personal care Massage parlors and spas<br /> 2. Outdoor and recreation Pools<br /> 3. Entertainment Bowling alleys, pool halls, roller rinks </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> 1. Control access points<br /> 2. Create a social distancing plan to manage and reduce contact with consideration for the West Virginia DHHR limitation of 2 persons per 1000 square feet<br /> 3. Reduce touch points to the maximum extent possible<br /> 4. Increase cleaning frequency and the availability of hand sanitizer, and disinfectant wipes<br /> 5. Establish an open line of communication with employees regarding safety </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> Screen employees reporting to work daily and all those who enter the building for<br /> COVID-19 symptoms with the following questions:<br /> o Temperature checks?<br /> o Have you been in close contact with a confirmed case of COVID-19?<br /> o Are you experiencing a cough, shortness of breath, or sore throat?<br /> o Have you had a fever in the last 48 hours?<br /> o Have you had new loss of taste or smell?<br /> o Have you had vomiting or diarrhea in the last 24 hours? </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> While on the worksite, gloves and eye protection appropriate to the task should always be worn. Employees should avoid sharing any type of PPE. If physical distancing cannot be used, workers in close contact or working in confined areas also should wear appropriate face coverings. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Maintain social distancing with a minimum of 6 feet of separation.<br /> 2. When possible, allow employees to work from home. If that is not feasible, employers should consider modifying work schedules to stagger work, providing alternating workdays or extra shifts to reduce the total number of workers on a job site at any given time.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Ensure workers are following proper workplace hygiene and using personal protective equipment. Educate workers on proper workplace hygiene practices. Employees should avoid touching their faces (e.g., eyes, noses, mouths) and cover coughs and sneezes with their arm or a tissue, which should be promptly discarded.<br /> 2. Educate workers on the importance of hand-washing and decontamination. To prevent the spread of the COVID-19 virus in the workplace, train employees on proper hand-washing practices. Provide employees with access to soap, clean running water and materials for drying their hands<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Implement workplace cleaning and disinfection practices, according to CDC guidelines, with regular sanitization of common surfaces. Ensure that staffing and supplies available for such facilities is sufficient to enable enhanced sanitization and cleaning measures in accordance with appropriate CDC guidelines. <br /> 2. Contact with doorknobs, switches, buttons, and any point of sale equipment should be limited to the maximum extent possible and frequently cleaned and sanitized. The number of touch points in the building should be reduced and limited to the maximum extent possible. The entrance/exit doors should be sanitized routine </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Designate a safety officer or someone within the company to be responsible for responding to COVID-19 concerns at every worksite location. Workers should know who this individual is and how to contact them.<br /> 2. If an employee indicates symptoms of the COVID-19 virus, they should immediately notify the employer/designated safety officer and stay home. It is critical for employers to support and encourage their employees to do this.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Open Now</strong><br> Permitted to Open </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.charlestonwv.gov/documents/covid-19-fmla-leave-expansion-and-emergency-paid-sick-leave-policy-tue-04072020-1101"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-18 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://extension.wvu.edu/community-business-safety/safety-health/workplace-safety/general-workplace-safety-guidance-for-reopening"> General Workplace Safety Guidance </a><a target="_blank" href="https://governor.wv.gov/Documents/Covid%20Additional%20Guidances/2020.06.11%20Guidance%20for%20Government%20Office%20Buildings.pdf"> Government Office Buildings </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Wisconsin')" data-value="54" class="collapsible">Wisconsin</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> Stay at home order struck down by state Supreme Co </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/WIGOV/bulletins/28b7302" target="_blank"> Safer At Home (unenforceable) </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://www.dhs.wisconsin.gov/publications/p02653a.pdf" target="_blank"> Badger Bounce Back </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation (Golf courses; State parks)<br /> 2. Personal care Pet groomers for curbside drop off<br /> 3. Retail stores<br /> 4. Restaurants & Bars(25% capacity) <br /> 5. Businesses (50% capacity, with a maximum of 250 people)<br /> 6. Child care centers (operate at half capacity)<br /> 7. Gyms (25% capacity) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> The Badger Bounce Back plan recommends that people over age 60 and those who are medically vulnerable should continue to shelter in place through Phases 1 and 2 for some businesses and operations. Refer to the Badger Bounce Back plan for details. <br /> <br /> Have conversations with employees if they express concerns. Some people may be at higher risk of severe illness. This includes older adults and people of any age with serious underlying medical conditions. <br /> <br /> By using strategies that prevent the spread of COVID-19 in the workplace, you will protect all employees, including those at higher risk. These strategies include: <br /> <br /> 1. Implement telework and other social distancing practices. <br /> 2. Require employees to stay home when sick. <br /> 3. Promote handwashing.<br /> 4. Provide appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) and supplies for cleaning and disinfecting workspaces. <br /> 5. In workplaces where it's not possible to eliminate face-to-face contact, consider assigning higher-risk employees work tasks that allow them to maintain a six-foot distance from others<br /> 6. Place posters at the entrance to your workplace and where employees and customers are likely to see them<br /> 7. Post signage on the front door letting customers know about changes to your policies and instruct them to stay away if they are experiencing COVID-19-like symptoms<br /> 8. Provide regular updates to let employees know what they can expect<br /> The following are minimum guidelines that apply to all workplaces. Some workplaces, dependent on industry and risk level, may have stricter regulations. Please visit the link for more information, https://wedc.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/COVID-19-GENERAL-Guidelines-ENGLISH-1.pdf. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Temperature checks and/or symptom screening: identify and isolate sick people<br /> 2. Encourage employees to self-monitor symptoms. <br /> <br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Train workers who need to use PPE on how to put it on, use/ wear it, and take it off correctly. <br /> 2. Workers who have frequent, close contact with customers or other workers may need to wear some combination of a face mask, a face shield and/or goggles. PPE for workers will vary by work task and the types of exposures workers have on the job<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Physical space should be increased between employees and customers to maintain at least a six-foot distance at all times. The capacity of customer-facing businesses should be reduced to ensure that adequate distancing is possible. <br /> 2. Downsize operations<br /> 3. Discourage sharing office tools and equipment <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Provide soap and water in the workplace. Consider scheduling handwashing breaks so employees can wash their hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds<br /> 2. Use hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol if soap and water are not available. Place hand sanitizer in multiple locations to encourage good hand hygiene practices.<br /> 3. Provide tissues and no-touch trash receptacles. <br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Before opening: Sanitize your business to limit the spread of virus to your employees and customers. <br /> 2. After opening: Disinfect common and high-traffic areas Common areas include door handles, desks, phones, light switches, and faucets<br /> <br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Recommended</strong><br> 1. Develop a procedure for employees to report when they are sick. <br /> 2. Do NOT allow symptomatic people to work. Send them home if they arrive at work. Do not allow them to return until they meet one of the CDC strategies to discontinue isolation and have consulted with a health care provider or health department. <br /> 3. Wait 24 hours before cleaning and disinfecting to minimize the potential exposure<br /> 4. Clean dirty surfaces with soap and water before disinfecting them<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Partially Opened </strong><br> Some hospitals have resumed </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed for the academic year </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="https://docs.legis.wisconsin.gov/misc/lc/issue_briefs/2020/covid_19/ib_fmla_msk_2020_27_03"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-18 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="https://wedc.org/reopen-guidelines/"> Reopen Guidelines </a><a target="_blank" href="https://wedc.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/COVID-19-General-Guidelines.pdf"> General Guidelines </a><a target="_blank" href="https://wedc.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/COVID-19-Professional-Services-Guidelines.pdf"> PROFESSIONAL SERVICES </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
<button onclick="handleOutboundLinkClicks(event, 'CNRG click on Wyoming')" data-value="55" class="collapsible">Wyoming</button> <div class="collapsible-content"><div class="cnt"><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> STAY AT HOME ORDER </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Order - End Date </div> <div class="content_right"> No stay at home order </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Stay at Home Executive Order </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://health.wyo.gov/publichealth/infectious-disease-epidemiology-unit/disease/novel-coronavirus/covid-19-orders-and-guidance/" target="_blank"> Orders and Guidance </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Re-Opening Plan </div> <div class="content_right"><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/attachments/WYGOV/2020/04/23/file_attachments/1434620/COVID19_Metrics_04232020.pdf" target="_blank"> Transition Plan for a Healthy Wyoming </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Current Reopening Phase Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> Open now:<br /> 1. Outdoor and recreation (Gyms, (personal training and group classes for up to 20 participants), State parks) <br /> 2. Personal care (Hair salons, barbershops, tattoo parlors, massage therapy, etc.)<br /> 3. Food and drink Restaurant dining<br /> 4. Entertainment Movie theaters, entertainment venues<br /> 5. Childcare centers (permitted to have up to 25 persons total in a classroom) </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> GUIDELINES FOR EMPLOYERS </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Overview </div> <div class="content_right"> 1. Businesses shall maintaining a record of staff working hours by date and time for purposes of COVID-19 contact tracing; if such recordkeeping is done manually, sanitizing measures must be taken on the instruments used for recordkeeping in between use.<br /> 2. Signage must remind customers not to enter the business if they have symptoms of COVID-19, and the signage must be displayed at the business entrance.<br /> 3. Physical Distancing guidelines must be maintained.<br /> 4. Staff that come within 6 ft of customers or other staff shall wear face coverings.<br /> 5. Staff shall perform hand hygiene.<br /> 6. Businesses shall not operate without appropriate protective equipment for staff.<br /> 7. Hand sanitizer shall be available at the business entrance and immediately adjacent to all bathrooms. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Testing Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Information not available</strong><br> Information not available </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Symptom Monitoring </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific</strong><br> 1. Consider conducting daily in-person or virtual health checks (e.g., symptom and/or temperature screening) of employees before they enter the facility, in accordance with state and local public health authorities and, if available, your occupational health services.<br /> 2. If implementing in-person health checks, conduct them safely and respectfully. Employers may use social distancing, barrier or partition controls, or personal protective equipment (PPE) to protect the screener.<br /> 3. Complete the health checks in a way that helps maintain social distancing guidelines, such as providing multiple screening entries into the building.<br /> 4. To prevent stigma and discrimination in the workplace, make employee health screenings as private as possible. Do not make determinations of risk based on race or country of origin and be sure to maintain confidentiality of each individual's medical status and history. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> PPE </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Staff that come within 6 ft of customers or other staff shall wear face coverings.<br /> 2. Businesses shall not operate without appropriate protective equipment for staff.<br /> 3. Hand sanitizer shall be available at the business entrance and immediately adjacent to all bathrooms.<br />
</div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Social Distancing </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Required</strong><br> 1. Tables must be limited to groups of 6; a business may make exceptions for groups greater than 6 if the group is solely comprised of members from the same household.<br /> 2. Tables with patrons must be positioned such that patrons at different tables are at least 6 ft apart (and preferable 10 ft apart) on all sides when seated.<br /> 3. Gyms: Close-contact group activities, including close-contact sports, are prohibited; personal training is permitted. <br /> 4. Workout equipment must be no less than 6 ft apart (and preferably 10 ft apart), enforced by staff during operation. <br /> 5. Patrons may only be served at stations, or on workout equipment no less than 6 feet apart.<br /> 6. No patron shall remain in a waiting area prior to receiving services.<br /> 7. Services may be provided by appointment only.<br /> 8. Overall number of patrons in the entire facility must not exceed 1 person per 120 square feet and patrons must remain physical distancing.<br /> 9. Swimming pools must be limited to one swimmer per lane. Spas and saunas must remain closed. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Hygiene </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific</strong><br> Gyms, personal care services and restaurants must have hand washing stations or hand sanitizer must be readily available for all patrons. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Cleaning </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific</strong><br> 1. Gyms, personal care services and restaurants must clean and sanitize after each patron, including cleaning all equipment and hand washing stations and surface sanitation.<br /> 2. Businesses shall encourage contactless and non-signature payment. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Confirmed Cases </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Industry Specific</strong><br> 1. Employees who have symptoms should notify their supervisor and stay home.<br /> 2. Sick employees should follow CDC-recommended steps. Employees should not return to work until the criteria to discontinue home isolation are met, in consultation with healthcare providers.<br /> 3. Employees who are well but who have a sick family member at home with COVID-19 should notify their supervisor and follow CDC recommended precautions. </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="stay_at_home_execution_order_name m-b-10"> OTHER INFORMATION </div><hr><div class="title_left"> Elective Surgery Status </div> <div class="content_right"> <strong>Now Open </strong><br> Resume 5/1 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> School Closure Status </div> <div class="content_right"> Ordered closed through 06/01/2020 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Short Term Disability Information </div> <div class="content_right"><a target="_blank" href="http://wyomingworkforce.org/data/epidemiology/coronavirus/"> Link </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Coalitions </div> <div class="content_right"> </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Last Updated Date </div> <div class="content_right"> 2020-06-05 </div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div><div class="title_left"> Sources </div> <div class="content_right sources_link"><a target="_blank" href="http://www.wyomingworkforce.org/data/epidemiology/coronavirus/"> Steps Employers Should Take </a><a target="_blank" href="https://health.wyo.gov/publichealth/infectious-disease-epidemiology-unit/disease/novel-coronavirus/covid-19-orders-and-guidance/"> COVID-19 Public Health Orders </a><a target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1LOAj8puy0LomGsPLbAmBuGPQTJ90A51b/view"> Fourth Continuation, and Modification, of Statewide Public Health Order </a></div> <div class="clearfix m-b-20"></div></div></div>
</div> <br> <div class="text-center"> <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1WRGTDWh1jWeDK5zqNhzTfhl5bDeuH3cOTZc09hBaGm8/viewform?edit_requested=true" target="_blank"> Suggest an Edit </a> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div> </main> <footer class="footer"> <div class="container"> <div class="row"> <div class="col-md-6 col-sm-12 col-xs-12 footer-copyright-container"> <span>Copyright &copy; 2020 Castlight Health Inc.</span> </div> <div class="col-md-6 col-sm-12 col-xs-12 footer-links-container"> <div class="footer-nav"> <ul> <li><a href="https://my.castlighthealth.com/faq/help-center" target="_self">FAQ</a></li> <li><a href="https://my.castlighthealth.com/security" target="_self">Security</a></li> <li><a href="https://my.castlighthealth.com/privacy" target="_self">Privacy</a></li> <li><a href="https://my.castlighthealth.com/terms-of-service" target="_self">Terms of Service</a></li> </ul> </div> </div> </div> </div> </footer>
